Name: Your Second Favorite Game Bundle
Your new Favorite Game Bundle
You Just Can't Make This Stuff Up
Description:
Sometimes in Scripture, we come across stories that are just so out there, so crazy, that we think, 'You just can't make this stuff up!' In this four-week series, we discuss four such stories and what they can teach us about ourselves, God, and how God can use us.

Series includes:
– Sermon text in Google Docs and Microsoft Word formats
– Title slides for the series and each message
– Original PSD

Name: You Can't Talk About That!
Description:
There are topics that every person has to deal with, regardless of whether or not they believe. Some of these topics are not discussed in church -- but should be! This 5-week series goes into five major issues that can affect any believer, and what Scripture has to say about them.

5 Weeks:
Week 1: Doubt
Doubt is normal. Share your doubt with people you trust and it will only be temporary.

Scripture: Galatians 6; John 20; Hebrews 11; Genesis 16

Week 2: Sexuality
We cannot treat someone badly just because their sin looks different than our own.

Scripture: 1 John 3; Matthew 5; John 13; Ephesians 4

Week 3: Addiction
You have something that no drug could ever duplicate and no habit could ever replace -- the knowledge that the creator of the universe and everything in it is sitting next to you personally while you go through your painful season, weeping with you and comforting you in the way that only he can.

Scripture: Psalm 24; Psalm 147; 2 Corinthians 12; Isaiah 53

Week 4: Depression and Self Image
If God himself -- the creator of the universe and everything in it -- believes that we are acceptable, capable, valuable, will never leave us alone, and will always forgive us; why should we believe any different?

Scripture: Jonah 4; 1 Peter 2

Week 5: Hell
This special discussion-based message is designed to open a dialog between you and your students on the reality and aspect of Hell.

Scripture: Revelation 14; Jeremiah 7

Download Includes:
Sermon manuscripts in Google Doc and Microsoft Word formats
Series title and individual sermon title slides
Original PSD files

Name: Wrecked - 4 week Sermon Series
Description:
When I was in college, God used a series of events in a matter of weeks to bring me to the lowest point I had probably ever been in my life. Alone, scared, guilt ridden, stuck. Scrolling through my Facebook feed, I saw the Lifehouse skit video shared by someone, and it wrecked me.

In that moment, the plans I had laid out for myself and the plans God had for me crashed into one another, and the aftermath left me picking up the pieces and rebuilding a far great life than I could have ever imagined.

Life is full of these types of moments, where we are wrecked. Sometimes it's in a way that humbles us, like my moment above. Other times, God leaves us in such Awe of Him, we leave the moment wrecked. This series spends 4 weeks looking at four different types of moments where God wrecks us, and how to deal with the aftermath. The end goal of each session is that we shouldn't fear these moments, because they lead to greater growth, deeper walks, new purposes in our lives.

This download contains 4 weeks, each  with a full transcript (plus full outlines for 2 weeks) as well as 2 social images per week, and a sheet with discussion questions to hand out to small group leaders for after each message.

Name: World Changer - Message on Bullying
Description:
This was a one-off message on bullying that I did recently. This was easily the most powerful message I've ever taught, the message caught the attention of every teenager in the room. This is an issue that every teenager everywhere has to deal with.

It was written with Andy Stanley's 'ME, WE, GOD, YOU, WE' format, it was written to first build tension and show how everyone is effected by this one thing and then resolve the tension with what God says on the matter. It has two YouTube videos to be shown, which play really well into the message and all of the teens loved them.

Name: Who is Jesus?
Description:
Every Youth Pastor wants their students to know Jesus and to know Him fully! This is a nine week series that covers all aspects of the question, Who is Jesus? The series include nine word-for-word message transcripts that vary length, but all are over 1,000 words.These are easily customizable to your specific context.

<strong>Who is Jesus? </strong>
Fully Man
Fully God
The Way
The Shepherd
The Truth
Redeemer
King
Lord

This download also includes an overview of each week that you can send to parents for further study and family discipleship.
Excerpt: An incredible 9 week teaching series on the most important question of your life!

Name: Who is it? Star Wars Edition
Description: Who is it? Star Wars Edition is a slide-by-slide based game that involves many of Star Wars' not-so well known characters, making it harder to guess who they really are. This is game is simple, and fun making it a great game to play at a Youth Ministry event.

Name: Who Is God
Description:
In this 4 week sermon series, students will get to study how God introduces himself in Moses’ origin story in the beginning of Exodus. Pharaoh asks “Who is the Lord that I should obey him…?”, and God reveals himself in this book of the Bible.  Students will discover a few character attributes of God that we can see from how he interacts with Moses, the Egyptians and Israel.  Scripture-loaded Sermons include these topics:

Wk 1 – God is Lord – Exodus 5
Wk 2 – God is Creative – Exodus 1 &amp; 2
Wk 3 – God is Good – Exodus 1
Wk 4 – God is Relentless – Exodus 3 &amp; 4

The download includes four sermon manuscripts, series graphics for HD screens and Instagram, small group questions for each sermon, as well as printable challenge cards that can be passed out to students to continue their journey all week long.
Excerpt:
4 Weeks of manuscripts on the character of God
Fully editable documents (.docx) and .pdf formats
Includes Small Group Content
Includes HD slide graphics
Week 1 – God is Lord
Week 2 – God is Creative
Week 3 – God is Good
Week 4 - God is Relentless
Tags: Character of God | exodus | Sermon | Sermon Series | small group questions

Name: Who do you say I am?
Description:
Many students know about Jesus, and can even use some titles to describe Him. But, do those titles mean anything to their lives?

In this four week series, we look at the book of Mark and some of the titles that are used for Jesus. Then, we dive deep into what these mean and how they should apply to our lives.

Week 1 - Son of God
Week 2 - Messiah
Week 3 - Lord
Week 4 - King

This series will paint a big picture of who Jesus is for your students, with the goal that Jesus is not just a small buddy we tack onto our lives, but that He is the ruling and reigning King over all things!

This series comes complete with each week's complete manuscript in a fully editable format (.pages or .doc). Each manuscript also includes suggested discussion questions and slide prompts for your presentation. Also included are the title and background slides for presentation.
Tags: I Am | King | Lord | Messiah | Son of God

Name: Which is worse?
Which is more?
Description:
Which is more is a great game for splitting your group in half. Depending on your group size, it can either be an upfront game between contestants, or it can be a crowd game.

In Which is more, we put two items up on the screen, and players have to decide which of these costs more. So things like 45 grande pumpkin spice latte's vs. 2 pairs of ugg boots, or an xbox 1 x vs. a nintendo switch?

This download contains 11 questions and answer slides, as well as a remade powerpoint presentation preloaded with the game, so you can download and play today!

This will test the movie quote knowledge of your students in this screen game in PowerPoint or your favorite presentation software.

Description:

Product Includes: Powerpoint Slides, JPG's

Name: Where in the World of Disney?
Description:
Much like our game Where in the World, this game is all about identifying locations. But in this edition, there is no zoom, we simply show you a scene from a Disney movie and the contestants have to correctly identify what movie the image is from before their opponent.

This download comes with 11 rounds, with a clue and answer slide for each round, each individual so you can easily drop them in your presentation software. It also comes pre-packaged in a powerpoint so you can download and play it straight away

Name: Where in the world?
Description:
Where in the world is a powerpoint game for your group to play and pinpoint the location a picture is showing. Each round starts extremely zoomed in, but slowly backs out, until the full landmark can be seen and it becomes obvious where it is.

This download comes with 11 rounds of locations, 3 slides per each round, and it comes pre-packaged in a powerpoint so you can download and play it right away!

Name: Where in the Bible?
When You Pray
Description:
Jesus talks to believers in Matthew 6:5-15 with the expectation that they would pray. He uses the language 'when' instead of the language 'if.' It was not a hope, but an assumption that believers would pray. This 3-part series will cover first the necessity of prayer, then will look at the ACTS method of prayer, and will finish off looking at how we can pray with effectiveness. This journey is certain to transform your understanding of prayer, especially week three, as we look at how our actions can determine the effectiveness of our prayer.

This download contains 3 message transcripts for 3 weeks of teaching content.

Name: What's The Point? One Off Sermon
Description:
All people, especially teenagers, are looking for purpose and fulfillment in their lives. But, when we aim on finding purpose and fulfillment in the wrong things, we'll always come up empty. If life isn't meant to be about us, then what's the point?

Solomon spent the entire book of Ecclesiastes talking about this very subject, which is very applicable to students today. This one-off sermon will help your students see that there is more to life than the here and now, and give them six practical steps to begin living out a fulfilling life found only in God.

This sermon comes with a fully editable manuscript (pages or docs) and title and background slides (.psd or .jpeg) ready to be used in your presentation. Suggested illustration ideas and slide prompts are included in the manuscript.
Excerpt:
Fully editable sermon manuscript (Pages or Word)
Title and Background Slides (.psd or .jpg)
Suggested illustrations and slide prompts
Notes: I hope that you love this one-off sermon and that it is a great help to your ministry. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to me and I'll get back to you as soon as possible. If you love the sermon, please make sure to leave a review so others will be able to utilize it as well!

Name: What's the Catchphrase? YouTube edition
Description:
Just about every student in your group will love the bit of nostalgia that comes with this game looking at some of the most memorable Youtube videos. Every once in a while, a video comes about that instantly becomes pop culture, shirts are made,  celebrities born (for 15 minutes), autotunes come and memes are made.

That's where this game comes in. We grabbed screenshots of 11 of the most quoted YouTube videos, videos with catchphrases we are all probably tired of, and contestants have to shout out the catchphrase made famous by the video.

This, and <a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/downloads/whats-the-catchphrase/">Whats the catchphrase - movies edition</a>, would be great to use on a night talking about words, because both editions illustrate how memorable our words can be, how powerful they can be.

This download comes with 11 rounds, with a clue and answer slide for each round as individual images you can drop into your presentation software. It also comes pre-packaged as a powerpoint file, so you can download and play it right away!

Name: What's the Catchphrase?
Description:
If your students are movie buffs, they are going to love this game. This, and it's follow up YouTube Catchphrase, would be great to use on a night talking about words, because both editions illustrate how memorable our words can be, how powerful they can be.

In this edition, we show a scene from a popular movie, and the contestant has to tell us what catchphrase that movie is best known for. Maybe it's 'Show me the Money!' from Jerry Macguire, or 'May the force be with you' from star wars, we tried to make it so the sayings were easy but not so much the scenes.

This download comes with 11 rounds, with a clue and answer slide for each round as individual images you can drop into your presentation software. It also comes pre-packaged as a powerpoint file, so you can download and play it right away!

You’ll get 10 questions and answer slides, plus a tie-breaker question and answer, along with a complete ready-to-use PowerPoint file, so you can download and play!

Name: Viva! Wanting
Description:
Starting around November 27th (or even earlier) marketing agencies ramp up for a war. They battle for limited space in the human heart. They compete for deep seated longing in the desires of people, and they make grand promises of fulfillment from new products and gadgets. They are smart. They know each person is created with deep desires springing from our basic needs for freedom, connection, accomplishment and significance. But they miss, year after year. Those “got to have” products don’t fulfill the way they promise. They fade over time and become novelties.

This VIVA! series focuses on humanity’s search for fulfillment. Every teenager has their wish list: Beats headphones, selfie sticks, Instax cameras, iPhone S’s, infinity scarves. They top the list of this year’s wishing season. Behind these wish-lists are the deeper desires of their lives. These lessons dig deeper into those hoped for gifts to find the lives God created teenagers for. They reveal the basic needs we all struggle to find through things and how they can only be found in Christ.

Week One – Why We Want

Week Two – What We Really Want

Week Three – Who We Are

Week Four – Finding Significance

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Trees
Description:
Trees? Really?

Yes, really. And not just any trees—some very specific trees. Look, life is real—gritty, sweaty, physically-demanding real. It’s all well and good to think out spiritual things in your head and carry lofty theological concepts around in your brain, but eventually your feet have to hit the ground and walk out the door into real life.

This VIVA! Series will have your group examining how 4 trees in scripture demonstrate real-life implications for us as they talk about:

Week 1 – The Oak: Absalom’s run-in with the oak tree reminds us that in real life, there are things that will try to hold us back.

Week 2 – The Fig: Even Jesus faced situations where normal life just didn’t seem to go his way.

Week 3 – The Sycamore: Zacchaeus shows us sometimes in life we just need a leg up.

Week 4 – The Olive: Paul demonstrates that God’s kingdom has come to bring new life to all lives.

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Today
Description:
In his gospel, Luke tells us of the moment Jesus began his public ministry by opening up the scroll of Isaiah and dropping his mic right there in the synagogue. Jesus speaks to the hopes and joys people had been waiting for, and opens up the transformative work of it all to those who believe, then and now.

This VIVA! Series will guide your group through Jesus’s sermon and, from later in his life, his mind-blowing promise that those who believe in him will do even greater things—and that we have everything we need to be a part of it all, right now, today.

Week 1: What does it mean to know the poor well enough to be able to truly bring good news, today?

Week 2: Is there anything more intimidating that being asked to free prisoners and restore sight to those who are blind? Well, Jesus asks it of us, and we’ll discuss how that can look, today.

Week 3: Today, we can be a part of setting the oppressed free and proclaiming the year of the Lord’s favor. But first we should take a look at what that actually means and why it’s worth fighting for.

Week 4: Phew, we finally worked our way through the high-bar topics from within Jesus’s first sermon and can move on to some nice words he shared near the end of his life, right? Like when he said “Very truly I tell you, whoever believes in me will do the works I have been doing, and they will do even greater things than these…” Uh, what? Greater things than Jesus? What do we do with that??

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Titus
Description:
Growing in our relationship with Christ isn’t just for people who attend services or youth group, but it’s also for those who are leading the church. It doesn’t matter how long someone has been a Christ follower or what title they may hold in leadership; there are always ways that we can grow more in the likeness of Jesus. The letter written by Paul to Titus helps remind us of this lesson.

During one of his missionary journeys, Paul left Titus on the island of Crete to lead the church community there. He then writes to encourage Titus in his own faith, give him guidance on organizing the church, who to appoint as leaders, and advise him on the things he should be teaching to the community. Most of all, he reminds Titus repeatedly in the letter what the whole point of his work really is.

Viva! Titus will explore this letter from Paul and discuss how the lessons written for Titus and the Cretans back in the first century translate to our lives today. Here is what we’ll be discussing:

Week 1: The Plan (Titus 1:1-4)

Week 2: Leading Well (Titus 1:5-16)

Week 3: Living Well (Titus 2:1-3:2)

Week 4: Don’t Forget (Titus 3:3-15)

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Have ideas about this curriculum? Be part of the revolution and give us some feedback at https://theyouthcartel.zendesk.com/home

Name: Viva! The Early Church
Description:
The church has been around for almost 2,000 years and there are a lot of materials that we can find about what church should look like and be about. When it was first starting after Christ ascended to heaven, his first followers didn’t have church growth books to build from. Regardless, these followers of The Way, charged ahead with a passion to share the story about Jesus and build a community centered around his resurrection.

The book of Acts tells the story about how these early Christians were coming together, what they cared most about and how they were living out their faith in Jesus. This series of Viva! will explore four important stories from the life of the early church and ask how we can apply them to our lives today.

Here is what we’ll be discussing in Viva! The Early Church:

Week 1: Judas’ Replacement (Acts 1:15-26)

Week 2: Pentecost (Acts 2:1-13)

Week 3: The Beautiful Gate (Acts 3:1-10)

Week 4: Everything in Common (Acts 4:32-37)

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! The Christmas Story
Description:
Thanks to nativity scenes and Christmas pageants, most people are familiar with the story of Jesus’ birth…but maybe we’re too familiar? The fact is, nativity scenes and your typical Christmas pageants that chronologically tell the Christmas story aren’t the full story. When you read the Gospel accounts of the birth of Christ, you have two different stories (Matthew and Luke) that don’t line up easily. Additionally, John offers a metaphorical account while Mark, the first gospel written, apparently didn’t feel that the virgin birth story was worth mentioning.

Rather than just taking the Gospel records and combining them to fit a historical timeline, it’s important to take the time to understand what each God-inspired author is trying to communicate with the way they tell the story. Each writer is purposeful about what they include and why. In this VIVA! Series we will invite your group into exploring these elements as you explore the Christmas stories of the Bible. Here is what we’ll be discussing:

Week 1: Mark’s (Non)Account

Week 2: Matthew’s Account

Week 3: Luke’s Account

Week 4: John’s Account

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.
<div class='grammarly-disable-indicator'></div>
<div class='grammarly-disable-indicator'></div>

Name: Viva! Stewardship
Description:
Stewardship. One of the most church-y words of them all that calls to mind sermons on money, remembering to tithe our money, and passing around collection plates for… money.

But what if the word was able to mean more to us, and especially our youth, than just money? What if the word stewardship drew up feelings of inspiration, blessing, and possibility?

This VIVA! series will help you and your students reclaim the word stewardship from simply meaning to tithe, and allow it to drive their thinking in terms of blessing, possibility, creation care, time, and yes, money.

Week 1: To Bless Others
To be a steward is to be someone who looks after, or takes care of, what has been entrusted to you. One of the most important things we as followers of Jesus have been called to do is care for each other. This week’s lesson will help us to see our participation in stewardship as a direct call from God to take the resources available in His kingdom and use them to bless others.

Week 2: Time
365 days in a year. 24 hours in a day. 60 minutes in an hour. 60 seconds in a minute.

We have zero control over time. There is nothing we can do to slow it down, speed it up, or hit pause like Zack Morris. Some people fill their days with near-constant activities and expectations while others sit around waiting for something to do that feels worth getting off the couch for. In this lesson your group will get a chance to take a look at themselves as stewards of time, discussing what it could look like to manage their time in a way that honors themselves, those around them, and God.

Week 3: Creation
At times it is necessary to take a step back and appreciate just how big God is. In the entirety of the known and unknown universe there is but one earth: one place where life of all kinds exists and thrives as part of God’s good plan. Scripture makes it clear that one of the greatest gifts we have been given is the earth and all that’s within it. As humans, we were given that gift along with the great responsibility of being its stewards. This lesson will help your group wrestle with the ways we have, and haven’t, been good stewards of the earth God created.

Week 4: Money
For better or worse, money makes the world go ‘round. This week’s lesson will create opportunities for reflection and discussion to help your group be stewards of their money in such a way that our world may go ‘round, a little more often, for the better.

They’ll take a look at where their money comes from, how it gets spent, how it can be used to bless or curse, and, yes, how it can be given to support the work of the church.

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Routines
Description:
We have a love/hate relationship with routines. They can seem to provide order and peace of mind, but they can also become deep ruts from which we must fight to free ourselves.

So what do we do?

This VIVA! Series will have your group examining the important of being both mindful and intentional about how they live their lives and shape their spirituality. Here’s our roadmap:

Week 1: Planning Ahead—if we don’t plan, our time will fill itself.

Week 2: Prayer—one of the most basic elements of spirituality, yet often neglected.

Week 3: Preparation—we only achieve what we set ourselves up to achieve.

Week 4: Sabbath—too often the victim of flooded schedules.

Name: Viva! Pretend
Description:
Who hasn’t wanted to rewrite reality at some point? There are days when we wish we could just disappear, days we wish we could set aside our troubles, and days we wish we could change circumstances at will.

But everywhere we go, there we are.

This VIVA! Series will walk your group through some of the ways and reasons that we sometimes pretend things are not as they are. Here’s where we’re headed:

Week 1: Fudging the Details—when we attempt to misrepresent our relationships

Week 2: Are You Feeling OK?—Disguising our emotions

Week 3: Who Are You—When we misrepresent ourselves

Week 4: Pay No Attention—When we try to remove ourselves from a situation

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Passion
Description:
The Entry – Jesus begins his final week of life by riding into Jerusalem during Passover and announcing his reign as King… on a donkey. How did Jesus’ entrance into Jerusalem show him to be far more than just a humble man willing to ride on a donkey, but as a King who was subverting the expectations of the powerful and peasant alike?

The Temple – This lesson will explore the temple culture, Jesus’s reaction to it and how we can allow him to “turn things over” in our lives.

The Curtain – This lesson will continue our look at the last week of Christ’s life and specifically key in on the tearing of the temple curtain after his death. The temple, and more specifically the Holy of Holies, was where God dwelled, where heaven met earth. The curtain separating us from God came down so we all can experience and participate in heaven meeting earth without barrier.

The Mission – Betrayal, violence, death and disappointment. What a way for the last week of Jesus’s life to wrap up. But then Jesus comes back- with more power and authority than ever. This lesson will look at how the resurrected Jesus chose not to confront his enemies, but to spend the time to find his followers, put his arm around them and bring them back into his mission. The same mission we get to participate in today.
How to Use Viva

We wrote this curriculum for those of us who might have been given a last minute assignment to lead a group. If you can put your hands on the supplies you should be able to walk in and teach this lesson with minimal prep. But you don’t have to wait to the last minute either. All groups benefit from preparation. So take some time, if you have it, to read through the lesson before you meet.

Each of these lessons can be led in different ways. Please be sensitive to your group. You might have a group that really wants to dig into an idea, or you might have a group that just needs to hear the basic truth. You get to decide that as you meet.

Finally, please feel free to discard any of this content to stay in your group’s context. The best curriculum for your group is you, caring for them as they get to know God.

Viva is Alive includes PDF files for your lessons.

Have ideas about this curriculum? Be part of the revolution and give us some feedback at https://theyouthcartel.zendesk.com/home

Name: Viva! One-Offs
Description:
We’re trying something a little different with this round of VIVA! We know there are times when what you need is not a four week series, but a one-off lesson to fill the gaps. We know the reality of a Saturday night “Oh no, we don’t have a lesson for tomorrow morning!” moment, and we are here to help. VIVA! One-Offs are full lessons that can stand on their own. An hour’s worth of activities, content and discussion that doesn’t need to be part of a series, but can still help your group take a look at scripture and a topic that matters in their world.

Week 1: Music &amp; Worship

Music is constantly around us. It’s playing overhead at the coffee shop, it’s in the soundtrack of our favorite TV shows or movies, and it’s in the songs constantly flowing out of small white earbuds into our ears and our brains. As a species, we love music. Using discussion, scripture, and the lyrics of your group’s favorite worship songs, we’ll spend this lesson looking at worship and music and why they work so effectively to connect us to God.

Week 2: Education

School is hard. Understanding calculus and Chaucer is tough enough. But that’s not nearly as hard to deal with as the pressure to live up to the expectations of parents, friends, ourselves-and to achieve the American Dream. We need to get the grades to get into the school to get the job to get the money to get the secure future. But does this view of education make sense in God’s Kingdom, or has there been a disconnect somewhere along the way?

Week 3: Worthy

We all have labels we wear. Some we give to ourselves and some are given to us by those in our life. Our labels too often make us feel like we aren’t good enough or worth enough when Jesus is wanting to give us different, truer labels that mark us as worthy. This week’s lesson will use a simple self-portrait, the story of Jesus’s interaction with the woman at the well, and a lot of discussion to show each of us that not only do we have worth, but we are worthy.

Week 4: Fear

There are plenty of things in life to be afraid of: spiders and snakes, falling off a cliff while hiking, giving a presentation in school and forgetting each and every word of it. A lot of us also have fear and anxiety about less tangible things, such as losing a friendship, disappointing our parents, or the future. We all probably know, on some level, that the Bible is full of verses that tell us not to fear or be afraid, but not many of us take the time to put that wisdom into practice in our lives. This lesson will help your group take a look at their fears (both obvious and less tangible) and see how those feelings can interact with scripture’s assurance of comfort.

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! One Another
Description:
At any given point throughout the day we are surrounded by other people. At home, at school, at the gym, at work, at restaurants, etc. And at each of those points, we choose how we will interact with one another. Will we ignore? Love? Mock? Accept?

As followers of Jesus we have some pretty clear directions as to how we should interact with one another-whether those closest to us or those we seemingly would have no cause to speak to. This four week set of VIVA contains games, videos, scripture exploration, discussion questions and more that will help us to see just how we are called to one another.

Week 1: Love One Another (John 13:33-35)

Ahhh yes, love. A word that can feel cliche in the Christian faith-but there’s no escaping just how foundational love is when living in the way of Jesus. In this week’s lesson your group will have the chance to look at the task Jesus gives his disciples to carry out once he is gone: to love one another. Loving one another, Jesus says, is actually the most effective way to help the world recognize who God is.

Week 2: Honor One Another (Romans 12:9-13)

When we think of giving someone an honor, those thoughts usually include things like ceremonies, medals, and plaques. But what does it mean to truly honor one another in the way scripture speaks of? This lesson will help your group explore Romans 12 and see whether Paul meant for us to frequently hold ceremonies of honor for one another or if it was something much simpler, but just as meaningful, that he had in mind.

Week 3: Carry One Another’s Burdens (Galatians 6:2-3)

In Galatians, Paul lets the reader know that one of the most important ways we can be in true community is to carry one another’s burdens. But, as Paul writes, in order to do so we have to know one another, and know what other people are going through. Our sin, our mess, our hardships. This week’s lesson is another look at a two-way street where the followers of Jesus are not only asked to carry the burdens of their community, but to allow their community to know and carry their own burdens.

Week 4: Encourage One Another (1 Thessalonians 5:9-11)

As your group wraps up this series on One Another, you’ll get an opportunity to look at what Paul meant when he said we must encourage one another. How can encouragement look like something more in our lives than having a personal cheerleader follow us around with pompoms while we do chores or take tests? How can encouragement not simply be something that’s done in recognition of our accomplishments, but something that moves us toward Jesus?

This lesson will use skits, video, and more to create dialogue and movement as your group explores what Paul meant when he said, “Therefore encourage one another.”

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! New Eyes
Description:
For teens who have grown up around church, there are those Bible passages that they’ve heard a hundred times. They heard them as kids, they heard them in youth group and they heard them in sermons. It’s become so tempting for them to just skip over them because they “know” what they say.

But here’s the thing: what if we don’t? The challenge that the Bible brings is that the most recent letters were written down almost 2,000 years ago and the Bible that you hold has been translated a few times over. Reading the Bible isn’t so simple because just taking the English words at face value may miss things going on in the original language or context. The fact is, there are some amazing and insightful things going on in the text if we just learn to dig a little and see things with new eyes.

This is what this Viva! is all about. We’ll explore four passages where you may be tempted to say, “Been there, done that,” and we’ll ask some questions and dig a little to see if there are some things we may have missed beneath the surface.

Here is what we’ll be discussing in Viva! New Eyes:

Week 1: The Lost Son (Luke 15:11-32)

Week 2: The Great Commission (Matthew 28:16-20)

Week 3: Spiritual Gifts (1 Corinthians 12:1-11)

Week 4: Creation (Genesis 1:1-2:3)

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Missions
Description:
Following Jesus doesn’t just mean that we are waiting to go to heaven as if it’s this other dimension somewhere else. Following Jesus means that we are actively working to bring about heaven on earth in the here and now. That is the mission of the Church and everyone is invited to participate.

In the book of Acts, Jesus told his first followers that they would be his “witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.” This series of Viva! will explore four stories from the life of the early church about how serving that mission started to take shape and what we can learn about continuing to live it out.

Here is what we’ll be discussing in Viva! Missions

Week 1: Seven Are Chosen (Acts 6:1-15)

Week 2: Simon the Sorcerer (Acts 8:9-25)

Week 3: Samarians and a Eunuch (Acts 8:1-8, 26-40)

Week 4: Peter’s Vision (Acts 10:1-48)

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Jonah
Description:
Was it a whale or a “great fish”? It doesn’t matter. What matters about Jonah is that it’s the clever story of a somewhat burned out prophet who has lost his motivation to follow God’s leading along with his desire to see anyone actually respond to God’s message!

This VIVA! Series will have your youth unpacking Jonah’s attitudes and motivation for reflection on their own opportunities to participate in kingdom work as they follow him through:

Week 1: Trouble! Jonah hears from God and makes a town line dash, only to endanger a boatload of innocent sailors.
Week 2: Time Out: Jonah finds himself in the penalty box with plenty of time to think.
Week 3: Trabajo (that’s “work” in Spanish): Jonah finally gets down to business. Sort of.
Week 4: Temper Tantrum: Jonah’s true self emerges, revealing the reality of his attitude toward honoring God with his life.

Name: Viva! Inheritance
Description:
What does it mean to inherit the kingdom of God? And how does inheritance work, anyway? In our current culture, we’re relatively removed from the older concepts of inheritance and birthright that dictate the movement of power and occasional wealth in scripture. Also common in the culture of our scripture is the tendency toward exclusion of women, a trend that still has hurdles to overcome today.

In this Viva! Series, your youth will have an opportunity to unpack some of the challenges to inheritance that women in our scripture faced, through the eyes of four lesser-explored female characters.

Week One – Nameless (Noah’s Wife)

Week Two – Cut off (Hagar)

Week Three – Second Best (Leah)

Week Four – Redeemed (Naomi)

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Greed
Description:
Who hasn’t wanted to rewrite reality at some point? There are days when we wish we could just disappear, days we wish we could set aside our troubles, and days we wish we could change circumstances at will.

But everywhere we go, there we are.

This VIVA! Series will walk your group through some of the ways and reasons that we sometimes pretend things are not as they are. Here’s where we’re headed:

Week 1: Fudging the Details—when we attempt to misrepresent our relationships

Week 2: Are You Feeling OK?—Disguising our emotions

Week 3: Who Are You—When we misrepresent ourselves

Week 4: Pay No Attention—When we try to remove ourselves from a situation

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Good
Description:
We’re supposed to be on the good team as Christians, right? Then why do we so often have to remind ourselves (or be reminded!) of what “living like Jesus” really looks like in this world?

This VIVA! Series will walk down that road a little as it unpacks one of the most familiar verses from the minor prophets of scripture, Micah 6:8:

Week 1: Act Justly—what’s the least the rest of the world should be able to count on from Christians?

Week 2: Love Mercy—what does it look like for us to step across the line of “least required”?

Week 3: Walk Humbly—how can we reshape the way we participate in public conversation, especially when we disagree?

Week 4: With God—what’s the point in doing all of this, anyway?

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Genesis
Description:
Quite literally the beginning of it all. In this 4-part series you’ll get students thinking about the four big stories in the book of Genesis. We start with exploring the poetry and implications of God’s creation story. From there we look at the introduction of man into the world. Next, we take a look at the story of Noah. Finally, we take a look at the life of Abraham as God moves His creation from the fall of man to the restoration that’ll ultimately be found in Jesus.

Viva — Genesis

The Poetry of Creation
The Story of Adam and Eve
The Story of Noah
The Story of Abraham
How to Use Viva

We wrote this curriculum for those of us who might have been given a last minute assignment to lead a group. If you can put your hands on the supplies you should be able to walk in and teach this lesson with minimal prep. But you don’t have to wait to the last minute either. All groups benefit from preparation. So take some time, if you have it, to read through the lesson before you meet.

Each of these lessons can be led in different ways. Please be sensitive to your group. You might have a group that really wants to dig into an idea, or you might have a group that just needs to hear the basic truth. You get to decide that as you meet.

Finally, please feel free to discard any of this content to stay in your group’s context. The best curriculum for your group is you, caring for them as they get to know God.

About Viva

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Viva is Alive

Have ideas about this curriculum? Be part of the revolution and give us some feedback at https://theyouthcartel.zendesk.com/home

Name: Viva! Doubt
Description:
What is the role of doubt within our faith? There are some Christians who treat doubt like it’s a bad thing, but the truth is that doubt is totally normal for all of us, no matter the depth of our faith. More so, without doubt we wouldn’t need to have faith because we would be certain of everything we believe.

The fact is, the very thing that helps our faith grow and mature is doubt. Doubts are what lead to questions, which leads to digging deeper and exploring at greater depths, which then can lead to new truths and better understandings. In contrast, when we ignore our doubts, it damages and cheapens our faith because we cannot fully commitment to something we have not adequately explored.

This is what this Viva! will explore. We’ll look at four stories in the Bible that raise a lot of questions and doubts. We’ll lean in to some of the challenges these passages present and see if there are other ways to understand the accounts. Here is what we’ll be discussing:

Week 1: Noah and the Flood

Week 2: Exodus and the Ten Plagues

Week 3: Jonah and the Fish

Week 4: Ananias and Sapphira Drop Dead

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Death & Resurrection
Description:
Christ’s death and resurrection are the most important factors when it comes to following Jesus. The Apostle Paul bluntly wrote in 1 Corinthians 15:14 that if it weren’t for the resurrection, which obviously required Christ to die first, our faith would be totally pointless. As important and familiar as the story is to many, what often gets overlooked is the way the four accounts that we have at times differ from one another. Some include content that the others don’t. Why? Some of the authors contradict the others in some of the details. Why?

For some, these differences have led them to discredit the entire event of Christ’s death and resurrection. However, if we take the time to understand what the God-inspired authors are trying to communicate with the way they tell the story, it can lead to greater depth. This VIVA! Series will invite your group into these differences as you explore the most important story in the Bible. Here is what we’ll be discussing:

Week 1: Mark’s Account

Week 2: Matthew’s Account

Week 3: Luke’s Account

Week 4: John’s Account

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Community
Description:
We are wired to be in community with others, and it’s been that way from the beginning. God knew what he was talking about when he declared, “It’s not good for the human to be alone.” Yet, right from the start as well, we know that relationships don’t always come easy.

Even though being in community means a group of people coming together, healthy community starts with us as individuals. The way we approach a group and the attitudes that we embrace are what will drive whether or not the communities we find ourselves in are healthy or not. In Viva! Community we will explore four traits that we should embrace to do our part for strong and healthy communities.

Here is what we’ll be discussing:

Week 1: Embrace Differences (Mark 3:13-21)

Week 2: Embrace Humility (Philippians 2:1-11)

Week 3: Embrace Conflict (Matthew 18:15-20)

Week 4: Embrace Forgiveness (Matthew 18:21-35)

Name: Viva! Colossians
Description:
Many teenagers (as well as adults!) question Christianity today. They look at it as just one of many ways that we can connect with God and they ask if absolute truth even exists. If we’re honest, many even see Jesus, and more so the Bible, as outdated and irrelevant, and they set out to forge their own way to God. Interestingly the questions that get asked today about religion and the way to God are not the first time they are being asked. In fact, they’ve been asked since the beginning of humanity and are the exact questions that Jesus and the authors of the New Testament letters entered in to 2,000 years ago.

This VIVA! Series will invite your group into these very questions through the letter in the Bible to the Colossians. Here is what we’ll be discussing:

Week 1: Why does Jesus matter?

Week 2: Where do we find truth?

Week 3: What is the role of religion?

Week 4: Does it matter how we live?

Name: Viva! Catalyst
Description:
What causes us to move when we’re stuck? What helps us to realize a change is needed? What inspires us to live more fully into our identity as God’s beloved? Catalysts.

A catalyst can be defined as “a condition, event, or person that is the cause of an important change.” As followers of Jesus, we can either choose to ignore the catalysts in our lives that move us closer to Christ, or we can embrace the messiness of change.

This VIVA! series will have your group examine how catalysts in scripture demonstrate real-life implications for us as they talk and explore.

Week 1: Peter’s Vision: What happens when everything you thought was rigid and true opens up into freedom and new possibilities? Explore the vision God gives to Peter in Acts 10 and its complicated results involving supposedly unclean visitors.

Week 2: The Bleeding Woman: Sometimes a catalyst in one’s life comes at a low point: a time of isolation, sadness, confusion, or deep need—yet help may be just an arm’s length away.

Week 3: The Rich Young Ruler: When presented with a catalyst, it is entirely possible to ignore it and walk away.

Week 4: Nicodemus: It might do us all a lot of good to look at the long game when it comes to the catalysts in our faith and trust that forward movement, even if slow at times, is still movement toward God.

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! Anxious
Description:
No matter what study you look at, there is a consensus among mental health experts that anxiety in teens has been increasing over the last decade. Many even suggest that the picture the statistics paint is optimistic based on the stigma associated with being anxious. It can also be debated about the role faith culture plays into the discussion as well: does it increase the stigma or does it help get to the root of the issue?

Regardless of the answer, the fact remains that the issue needs to be discussed. For starters, according to the 2015 Child Mind Institute Children’s Mental Health Report roughly 80% of teens who have a diagnosable anxiety disorder are not getting the treatment they really need. Beyond that, with the rise of general feelings of anxiety, we need to create spaces where teens can safely discuss how they feel so that we can help them determine ways to promote healthier living.

Viva! Anxious will help your group dive into this important issue. We’ll explore the topic of anxiety so that your teens can recognize what it is, and isn’t. We’ll talk about how to deal with anxiety and look at some Scriptures that addresses the issue. Here is what we’ll be discussing:

Week 1: The Elephant in the Room

Week 2: Do Not Be Anxious

Week 3: Learning to Be Content

Week 4: Getting Practical

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: Viva! 1 John
Description:
Week 1: Light

Light and darkness are concepts we are all familiar with. Each and every day we see them at work as day turns into night and back into day again. The apostle John uses these concepts to help us understand true fellowship with God and to recognize the ways we fail at that fellowship. This lesson will help us see that a life spent walking in the light is a life of confident living—because it’s a life we know is full of the love God calls us toward.

Week 2: Abide

The concept of “abiding” in God is a common theme throughout John’s writings. But while “abiding” may be a fairly common word in church contexts, what does it actually mean for the lives of the kids in your community? This lesson will take a look at what John means when he calls followers of Christ to “abide,” and how abiding will help us remain with Jesus, experiencing the light and love John speaks of.

Week 3: Love

Love is a common theme when it comes to studying the life of Jesus, but John offers a fresh take on this expected word. He calls us to fill our lives up so completely with love that there is little room left for anything else. This lesson will help you and your students to recognize, as John did, that God and love are one and the same.

Week 4: Confidence

Throughout his letter, one of John’s key points is that when we abide in Christ’s light and love, we can lead a confident life. Despite times when we may have to deal, as John writes, with the hate of others, false things said about Jesus, or even the temptations of our world, ultimately we can still be confident because of Christ’s saving grace. In this lesson, we will look at how allowing ourselves to abide with God, full of light and love, also allows us to claim a lasting and deep confidence in who we are as Christ’s followers.

About Viva

Includes 4 lessons, instructions, and two slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, MediaShout, ProPresenter or another display system.

Viva is a series of short, downloadable, curriculum resources. Whether you are looking for a last minute lesson plan or ideas to add into your teaching, Viva is designed for youth workers leading the revolution.

Name: VIP guest badges
Video Scavenger Hunt list
Description: Over the last few years, I've ran several video scavenger hunts with Youth Groups, and my list has been tweaked, added to, thrown out, and above all, refined. It by no means is a perfect list, there will always be room for improvement, but this free download is a great start for your own list for a video scavenger hunt. Download it today for your next Youth Ministry Video Scavenger hunt!

Name: Vertical Sermon Series
Description:
God gave the Israelites his commandments to help them see who he is. They may seem like a guidebook for how to live, but they actually are to help improve our relationship with him and with others.

This series looks at 3 of those commands, the first 3 of the 10 Commandments, and puts them into the context of our lives to help us look at how we can improve our relationship with God. Included are Sermon Manuscripts, Small Group Questions, Slide backgrounds, and Instagram graphics.

Week 1: OTHER GODS - God wants a relationship with you
Week 2: NO IDOLS - God cannot be contained or controlled
Week 3: GOD'S NAME - We should honor God by how we talk about him
Excerpt: 3 Sermons on the first 3 of the Ten Commandments

Name: Valentines Countdown video
Description: A countdown video perfect for the month of February or a series on love and relationships. This resource comes with 1-minute, 3-minute, and 5-minute variations with music, and one without.

Name: Upcoming Events 5x7 card
Description:
It's always great to have something you can hand to parents and students with upcoming event information. This resource is a simple 5x7 card to help highlight those key dates in the coming months, perfect for keeping in your car or backpack to have ready when meeting students, but also a great tool to drop in your churches visitor bags!

This download is a photoshop file, so you'll need software to edit it.

Name: Uno Mas
Description:
In this modified version of the card game UNO®, players are going to discover that everyone is playing by a different set of rules, but not know what the rules are. The game will be played with regular UNO® cards, and it will start with the standard UNO® rules. Each student will also get his or her instruction card with a specific additional instruction on it that they cannot reveal until after the game.

This is a great game for a small group to start a discussion on grace or as part of a study of the parable of the Prodigal Sons, the book of Romans, or just for some great fun! If you have more than 10 players, break your large group into smaller groups and give each small group a set of instructions and cards to play with. This download does not provide you the deck of UNO® cards, you will have to provide them yourself.

Name: Under the Influence
Description: We are all under the influence of someone. Whether it is our parents, our friends, our teammates, or some other source, we are being influenced every day. This 4-part series is about strategically and intentionally choosing what influences us first and most.

Name: Un-Dumb Yourself: 4 week sermon series
Description:
Un-Dumb Yourself: 4 week series (based out of Proverbs)

I couldn’t count the number of dumb things I’ve down with both hands. We do dumb things. So
we begin to hear from people, “it’s ok if you make that mistake, as long as you learn from it.”
And over time somehow we’ve bought the lie that failure is the best way to learn. Our students
need to hear... “yes, learn from your mistakes. But it’s better to make wise choices.” And it all
starts with following Jesus.

Session One: Wise Decisions
Session Two: Be Teachable
Session Three: Discipline
Session Four: Stay Focused

This series includes:
- Title slide and a scripture slide
- Count down the days instagram pics (i.e. 3days until...) to build anticipation
- 3 instagram pics per session that is either a scripture or main idea from the previous session.
It helps the message to stick throughout the week.
- Some weeks include prop ideas and/or worship

Name: Ultimate Halloween Bundle
U R Missing Invite Card
Two Tone Business Card
Description:
This two tone business card will be simple for you to drag and drop your information to fully customize it for your name and ministry.

The front side is organized and ready for you to enter your name, title, and information for the church. You can even change the colors of the card to fit your ministry as you'd like it! It's that simple!

The back side is ready to add your logo by dropping it straight into the document!

This design is simple, clean, easy-to-use, and ready for you to customize it for your ministry!
Tags: admin tools | advertising | business cards | first impressions | office
Notes: Thanks for your purchase! Take a moment to check out my other products in the marketplace! Half of the proceeds from your purchase will be sent to support the children's home of Mountain Faith Mission of Haiti!

Name: TV Show Theme Song Trivia Game
Turn Off Selfie Mode One Off Sermon
Description:
Today's culture is very focused on self. We oftentimes think about ourselves more than others. But the commands of the Bible tell us to be humble and to think of others more often than we think of ourselves. This one-off sermon aims to help us turn off selfie mode and set our eyes on others by setting our eyes on Jesus.

This comes with a fully editable manuscript in both Apple Pages and Microsoft Word, as well as a title slide and background slide.
Excerpt:
Fully editable word-for-word manuscript
Suggested illustration and intro
Title and background slides
Notes: Thanks for your purchase! 50% of all the proceeds from any of my products is donated directly to Mountain Faith Mission of Haiti. Love the product? Please review it in the marketplace!

Name: Trust the Process Series Graphics
Description: 'Trust the Process' graphics package includes a series logo and a background slide that you can add your own text to in PowerPoint or ProPresenter. If you have graphic design skill, then edit the original file as well!

Name: Trust in the Lord Wall Art
Trunks and Treats Graphics
Description: Here is a neat little poster I had made for our Trunks and Treats event this past year. Full vector of the Honda Odyssey included with the download, comes as a fully editable photoshop file or a blank .png with just the artwork, so you can add the dates in any program you desire, even microsoft word!

Name: True 'or Nah'
Description:
Is the Fact True 'or NAH' ! This downloadable youth group game offers students the opportunity to identify if the given fact is True 'or Nah'. Simply show the fact and see if students can correctly guess if the fact is True 'or Nah. Works great as an upfront game to kick off a fun night at youth group.

This is a PowerPoint file, and easily editable or capable of being added to. Enjoy!

Name: True Facts of Truth
Description:
Have you ever heard a fact that was so random, it seemed there was absolutely no way it could be true, but upon further investigation is? This game capitalizes on those very facts. Some of these facts are SO OUT THERE, the only way someone would know them is if they were to spend hours on the internet every day, so basically, teenagers.

This great trivia game download contains 22 slides (11 questions and 11 answers) as well as a preloaded powerpoint presentation that requires no editing, so you can simply download and play!

Name: Triumphant Series Graphics
Description:
This Triumphant Series Graphics Package is designed to draw attention to your next teaching series and get your students excited about God and His power.  The series graphics package includes a vertical bulletin graphic as

well as projection slides and blank sides for sermon text.  All items are editable PSD files so you can easily use them as they are or change them to fit your theme.  Enjoy.

Fonts used are Baron Neue and Caviar Dreams.  Both are available online and also included in the zip file.

<em>*Note: You are downloading photoshop files, and you will need photoshop or a similar alternative in order to edit these files. You will also need a working knowledge of Photoshop to edit it.</em>

Name: Trendy Countdown video
Description:
This countdown video is a great way to start the night off with some hype and energy.

Featuring bright and energetic graphics, it comes with two versions, one with music and one without.

Name: Transformation Trivia Game
Description: Social media has brought about a ton of new trends, including Transformation Tuesday. This game plays off that concept and is sure to have your students laughing and guessing. This slide game features 10 celebrities that your students will know. Simply show the slide of the celebrity’s childhood photo and have students guess who it is. At the end, see who got the most correct. Easy to play and sure to energize your next youth group. All the slides are JPEGs for easy loading into any presentation software.

Name: Top 10 game
Description:
Top 10 is a fantastic group game your students will love, whether you have a group of 2 or 200. You can play it with two contestants up front or by having your entire crowd break into groups. It's sort of a combination of family feud, outburst, and scattegories, where the screen will display a name of a list of 10 things, and your groups will have 30 seconds to list as many things as they can on that list. The next slide will display our top 10, and groups get 1 point for every item they have on the list.

Game includes 10 top 10 lists to play through.
Tags: everyone plays | powerpoint game | screen game

Name: Titus: Being a Leader for Christ
Description:
This is a four week sermon series that walks through the Book of Titus while showing students how to be leaders for Christ!
This resource includes:
- 4 weeks of manuscripts
- 4 weeks of small group questions
- Social media graphics
- Presentation graphics

Name: Timers with blank backgrounds
Description: Ever had a really cool background for an event and wish you had a timer to go with it? Ever find a hilarious youtube clip and wish you could easily add a timer to it? Now you can! In this bundle there is a 5 minute, 3 minute and 60 second countdown (3 separate videos) for you to put on top of any image or video! All that's required is some video editing software and boom! Now you look good and customized.
Notes: Thanks for doing what you're doing! You're a champ! 1 Corinthians 15:58

Name: Three Unexpected Thanksgivings
Description:
It can be easy to be thankful when things are going well. It gets more difficult when things are not quite so full of rainbows and puppy dogs! This three-week series discusses three people in the Bible who showed thankfulness at a very difficult point in their life. This would be a great series for Thanksgiving or any time throughout the year!

Series includes:
- Sermon text in Google Docs and Microsoft Word formats
- Title slides for all sermons
- Original PSD file

Name: Three Sizes - 2019 Summer Calendar
Description:
Take the hard work out of your calendar for the summer of 2019! This file will give you three different easily editable files on Photoshop. You can make an 8.5x11 to give to your students, display 11x14 or 11x17 throughout your space, or do all three! Easily drop your logo into this file using a clickable smart object. Everything else is easily organized in monthly calendars for ease of design.

This calendar will make your life easy and simple in your planning!
Notes:
Thanks for your order of this calendar. My prayer is that it makes your planning and preparation easier! If you love it, please leave a review!

Also, thanks for your purchase. Half of the proceeds from your purchase of this calendar is used to support the children's home of Mountain Faith Mission of Haiti!

Name: This Is Why I'm Broke
Thesaurus Karaoke vol. 2
Description:
Is Lil Nas x taking his stallion to the decrepit city boulevard?

Well, he could have, if he had used a thesaurus. We felt like there were a lot of songs that, though catchy, just lacked a certain amount of elegance when it came to the used vocabulary. So we took well known chunks of lyrics from popular songs that most middleschoolers through highschoolers would know, and we ran every word through a thesaurus to come up with far greater lyrics.

This game is an absolute blast and was hilarious watching the students get completely stumped, only to see how simple the song came out to be.

This download package contains 11 songs with both the lyrics slide and answer slide, plus a slide for how to play, and the best part is that it all comes preloaded in a powerpoint, so you can just plug and play the game today!

<a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/product/thesaurus-karaoke/">Check out round 1 here</a>
Tags: game | lyrics | music | screen game | songs | thesaurus

Name: Thesaurus Karaoke Christmas songs
Description:
How well does a thesaurus work? How well do your students know synonyms? In this incredible screen game, we took some of our most beloved Christmas songs, and ran portions of the lyrics through a thesaurus, word for word, so that instead of dashing through the snow on a one horse slay, we could scamper over frozen-vapor in a single stallion, drop top toboggan.

This game is an absolute blast and was hilarious watching the students get completely stumped, only to see how simple the song came out to be.

This download package contains 11 songs with both the lyrics slide and answer slide, plus a slide for how to play, and the best part is that it all comes preloaded in a powerpoint, so you can just plug and play the game today!
Tags: carols | christmas | christmas game | lyrics | music | party | thesaurus

Name: Thesaurus Karaoke
Description:
What if OMI had found himself an encouragement commander instead of just a cheerleader?

Well, he could have  if he had used a thesaurus. We felt like there were a lot of songs that, though catchy, just lacked a certain amount of elegance when it came to the used vocabulary. So we took well known chunks of lyrics from popular songs that most middleschoolers through highschoolers would know, and we ran every word through a thesaurus to come up with far greater lyrics.

This game is an absolute blast and was hilarious watching the students get completely stumped, only to see how simple the song came out to be.

This download package contains 11 songs with both the lyrics slide and answer slide, plus a slide for how to play, and the best part is that it all comes preloaded in a powerpoint, so you can just plug and play the game today!

Check out me blend!

&nbsp;
Tags: game | music game | Powerpoint | screen game

Name: Theology 7 Week Teaching Series
Description:
Theology can sound like a big scary word, but it doesn’t need to be! Theology isn’t just for the professionals or the pastors, it’s for everyone. The word theology refers to the study of who God is and that is something that every Christian should aspire to. As a believer we want to know who God is and we do this by doing theology.

If you are looking for a series that will push your students a little deeper, then this is a great option for you! Here is what the outline of the series looks like:

Seven word-for-word manuscripts
1 – Who is God? The Trinity
2 – The Bible
3 – Salvation
4 – The Church
5 – The Image of God
6 – The Mission
7 – The End Times
Excerpt: Take your students deep into God's Word as you cover some of the hard topics in theology!

Name: The World of Sports Trivia
Excerpt: A Screen based Trivia Game to use for a Championship Game party or an Olympics Party or for any other occasion!
Notes:
This is one of three screen games for a four week series called "Go Fight Win" (coming soon) complete with four weeks of teaching, three weeks of small groups, graphics and a 5 minute countdown. 

In the meantime keep fighting the good fight. 1 Corinthians 15:58

Name: The Walking Dead - 3 Week Sermon Series + extras
Description:
Zombies at Youth Group?

Some might not think this is a great topic for a Youth Series, but we think the idea of zombies is a perfect analogy for several areas of our spiritual lives.

Over the three week Sermon series, you'll discuss how, similar to zombies, we are only shadows of what we were intended to be, how we hurt others without knowing why, and how we easily blend into the crowd.

This package also contains 3 weeks of questions to use in Small Groups to coincide with the sermons, prepared on great leader guide sheets to give your leaders a quick rundown of what they should focus on in their lesson.

We've also thrown in a great event guide for an awesome Zombie Attack game to use as a separate event or as part of a Youth Group Lock-in.

This download contains:

- 3 Sermon manuscripts, 3 sermon outlines in word and pdf version

- 3 weeks of small groups in word, pdf, and photoshop files

- Zombie Event for Lock-in plus promo graphics

Name: The Unforgiving Servant
Description:
This one-off message outlines the importance of forgiving others if we desire God's forgiveness. It will make students consider forgiveness where they otherwise haven't, and follows along with the Parable of the Unforgiving Servant in Matthew 18:21-35. This resource includes:
• Message Manuscript (1,000 words)
• Small Group Questions
• Social Media &amp; Title Slide (PDF)

Name: The Unexplainable
The Truth About Christmas Carols
Description:
Everyone knows that there are two types of Christmas carols: those that celebrate the birth of Christ and those that, well, don't. In this one-off message we learn that even the supposedly 'secular' carols do, in fact, celebrate the birth, life, or death of Christ -- if we only know how to listen.

Sermon includes:
- Sermon text in Google Docs and Microsoft Word formats
- Title slide
- Original PSD

Name: The Story of Moses Small Group Curriculum
The Squad - Matthew 4:18-22
Excerpt: Are you willing to leave behind your old life and follow Jesus into a life of mission and purpose?

Name: The Scrambler
Description:
We love games that get students talking to other students they might not normally strike up conversation with. Many sites call these types of games Mixers, so naturally, when we made a great mixer type game for our group that was slightly different, we just called it a scrambler!

This powerpoint 'game' doesn't have any winners or losers, but will get everyone up and out of their seat, finding a new group to chat with, and getting to know plenty of other students with a lot in common that they might find surprising.

This download contains 5 mixing slides and 5 discussion slides, all pre-loaded into a powerpoint so it's ready to go when you download it. Help your students know and be known by the rest of this group, grab this game today!
Tags: connection | every plays game | mixer | opener

Name: The Salt Life
The S Word
Tags: Sin | sinfulness | temptation | the fall | the s word

Name: The Rich Life sermon series
The Remedy - 4 week series through Colossians
Description:
This 4 week sermon series works through the book of Colossians to give the challenge to Students to live for Christ, that God has saved us so we can bring others to salvation in Him. Over 4 weeks, you'll study the book and see both the Supremacy of Christ, and the redemption He brings, that he has rescued us and through us will rescue others.

This download contains an outline of the series with bottom lines and basic ideas to help you prepare your own talks, as well as series artwork, including social graphics for each week's bottom line.

Name: The Radical Jesus - Teaching Guides - 9 Weeks
The Path of Purity
The Original Squads
Description: We all have our squads that we are a part of, but what about the original squads from back in the day? Using different squads from different movies in different eras, can you pick out which movie each squad belongs in?

Name: The Lords Chicken or The Other Place
Description:
Overview:
Do you know the different between Chick-fil-A and Popeyes? Test your ability to know the difference your favorite fast food restaurant. This game of 10 questions plus a bonus question that will challenge your student’s knowledge of your favorite chicken location.
