Notes: Thank you so much for purchasing this product! I hope this product blesses your ministry like it did in mine!

Name: The Letters of John: How to be the Light in Darkness
Description:
<em>This resource is also part of YouthMin.org's Ultimate Youth Ministry bundle! While you're more than welcome to purchase this resource individually, you can grab it as part of our massive resource pack that saves over 94%! Grab this, and an additional 100+ resources!</em>

The Books of 1, 2, and 3 John are very impactful books to teach students how to be the light in a world full of darkness. This series highlights 1 John for 3 weeks and then 1 week given to both 2 John and 3 John. This 5-week series will help your students see how they can be the change and light of Jesus through hard and dark times. In this series you will get:
-5 weeks of manuscripts
-5 weeks of small group questions
-Graphics
-Cover photo for social
-Psd files

Name: The Last Word
Description:
Got any know it alls in your Youth Ministry? Students who always have the last word when asked trivia questions? Then your group will love this game! (They'll more than likely love it even if you have no know it alls).

If you've played buzzwords in the past, then you'll love this game that is very similar. Instead of getting into groups and making lists over the course of a minute, contestants from teams come up front to see who can have the last word. A category will come up on the screen, such as presidents, and students shout out an answer first. They then take turns, alternating, between giving an answer to that category, until one takes more than 4 seconds or says a wrong answer. (So student A - Clinton, student B - Lincoln, student A - Bush, etc. etc.).

This game comes with 11 categories, so you're guaranteed a tie breaker for rounds. Plus, like all of our games, it comes loaded into a powerpoint so you can download it and play it in your Youth Ministry tonight!
Tags: screen game | upfront game | volunteer game

Name: The L Word
Description:
Love is a word that is constantly being thrown around in our culture today. We love our parents, but we also love pizza? How does that work? This four-week series goes into the different types of love, how we experience love, and ties it all together with the ultimate example of love: Christ.

Series includes:
- Sermon text in Google Docs and Microsoft Word formats
- Title slides for each message
- Original PSD

Name: The Holy Spirit
Description: This 3-part series discusses three aspects of the Holy Spirit: His presence, power, and prompting. This is a powerful lesson series designed to increase student's understanding of and dependence on the Holy Spirit.

Name: The Hardest Thing You'll Ever Have to Do
Description:
The hardest thing you'll ever have to do is witness to someone dying, and watch them deny the Gospel. This one-off sermon describes a time when that exact thing happened to me, my reaction to it, and what that taught me about witnessing.

Sermon includes:
- Text in Google Docs and Microsoft Word formats
- Title slide
- Original PSD file

Name: The Greatest Story Ever Told
Description:
This is a 2 week Christmas series that helps students see the long term impact of the nativity story. This series is complete with 1300+ word teaching manuscripts, small group discussion questions, and graphics for each week. Share with your students 'The Greatest Story Ever Told' this week!

<strong>INCLUDED</strong>
2 Word-for-word manuscripts
2 one page small group guides
Graphics for series including a PPT overlay (JPEG)

Name: The Gospel: a study through Galatians
Description: This is a 6 week series that takes students through the study of Galatians. Through this series students will walk through Paul's encouragement to the Galatians and learn why we hold to our faith. The first 3 weeks encourage us to reject societal calls to compromise and reaffirm the gospel. The last 3 weeks walk the students through what their decision to accept the gospel means for them. Let this series remind your students of the freedom we have in Christ and what it means to be a disciple.

Name: The Gift of Grace
Description:
Grace is a word that we use all the time in church circles, but the reality is, it often is only talked about, but not understood or applied in our lives. Because of grace, our lives have been radically changed...or at least they should have been. This series seeks to explain what grace is, what it does in and through us, and challenge us to live a life characterized by the grace of Jesus.

This product comes complete with full manuscripts (Pages or .doc) with illustration ideas, discussion questions and presentation cues, as well as editable series title slides and background slides (.jpeg or .psd).

Name: The Frank Bundle 2014
The Fallout Series Graphics
Description:
Fully editable Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop graphics to promote a teaching series. This file contains graphics formatted for Facebook event headers, Instragram pics, and a full-page flyer, plus background slides for SD or HD screens. These are great graphics to go along with a study of Sin &amp; the Fall, broken relationships, poverty, or more!

This digital download includes seven Photoshop .PSD files, seven .PNG samples, and an Illustrator .AI file with all graphic formats in one.

Name: the Face game
Description:
The face game is a hilarious game for groups of most any size. We have two players come on stage and stand back to back. A kind of face to make is put on the screen and on the game host's count of 3, the players must turn around and make the face to their competitor. Whoever laughs first, loses.

This game has 11 rounds, so there’s always a tiebreaker, and can be used in a number of different formats for your group. You can play with one volunteer up front trying to get 8 out of 11 correct for a prize, you can have two teams face against each other, you can have a different player each round for a small prize, or you could have your whole crowd pair up and play the rounds, with winners finding new partners each round. Like all of our games, it comes with individual images for you to insert into your presentation software of choice, but it also comes as a preloaded powerpoint and keynote for you to plug and play quickly.
Tags: game | stage game | upfront game | volunteer game

Name: The Disconnect - 4 Week Youth Ministry Sermon Series
Description:
When Youth Pastors talk about Social Media, we are talking about something we use. But for teens, it's almost something they live. Most of the students we minister to don't know a world in which they aren't connected to at least one social media network (though they probably don't understand that term).

But there are real dangers in Social Media. Students should absolutely have boundaries, sometimes for specific apps.

In this 4 week Sermon Series for Youth Groups, you'll discuss 3 of the most popular social networks that teens use, Instagram, SnapChat, and Youtube, and take a look at some of the dangers these apps pose. But more importantly, you'll look at what these apps portray about walking with and living for God.

In Week 1, we discuss twitter, and the importance of keeping whats important as important.

In Week 2, we discuss Instagram, and how easy it is to present a life that isn't true, how easy it is for our online presence to be disconnected from the real us.

In Week 3, we discuss Snapchat, and the need to be vulnerable with others while also protecting ourselves, which can be a real fine line.

In Week 4, we discuss YouTube, and the damage that can be done with words.

Download this great series today, your students are going to love it!

Name: The Call
Description:
This is a 4 week series surrounding the call of Moses and what it can teach us about the nature of God. This series goes through the first 4 chapters of Exodus and teaches and reminds students of some foundational truths about the God that loves us and calls all people to Himself.

Includes:
-4 Sermon outlines
-4 weeks of small group discussion questions
-Graphics for this series.

Name: The Biblical Church
Description:
How do we define what is a church and what is not? Can anything be a church that has a steeple?

Many of you already know the answer, the Bible. The Bible is what defines the big C church for us. Only the Bible has the authority to tell us what the church is, so as we begin our quest to understand what a church is a little better, let’s leave our assumptions and preferences at the door and let’s go to Scripture to define what the Big C Church is!

Name: The Ben Bundle 2014
The 2-Day Serve: Small Missions, Big Impact
Description:
The 2-Day Serve is an opportunity for your group to participate in service projects together that cost little to no money, are close to home, and can be scheduled as an introduction to mission trips or in conjunction with your yearly summer service/outreach events.

This product includes:
•What the 2-Day Serve is

•What a 2-Day serve looks like
•Steps for setting up a 2-Day serve
•Sample 2-Day serve schedule
•Sample Devotional Based on Mark 10
•Discussion Questions
•Sample Letter to Parents and Students

Name: Thanksgiving Thank You Postcards for Leaders
Thanksgiving Small Group Lesson
Description:
Bonus: Free Game! 'Thanksgiving Edition of Gorilla, Man, Gun'

One of the most powerful things that you, as the youth pastor, can do is to engage what is currently happening in the student's world and connect it with the gospel. This lesson attempts to bridge the season of Thanksgiving to the gospel.

Thankfulness is a single small group lesson with this as its’ goal:

Thankfulness – Small Group Guide

Psalm 103:7-12, Ezra 9:13, Romans 6:23, Psalm 103:8-12; 2 Corinthians 4:13-15

In small groups this week our hope is that every student leaves understanding where thankfulness comes from. Thankfulness comes from a proper view of self, God, and others

This download comes with the series graphics and the 3 page small group discussion guide. This download is a great lesson for small groups and could easily be adapted for a large group teaching time!

<a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/vendor/jholmes/">Click here to find more resources from Jonathan.</a>

Name: Thanksgiving Pollsters
Description:
The greatest polling game that has ever been created just got edited for the Thanksgiving season. This game is really fun for groups of 5 all the way to 1,000. One person from the group has to guess what percentage of people fit into the question on the screen. The audience then responds by either sitting (lower than the number given) or standing (higher than the number given).
<p style="text-align: center"><em>The download includes 20 videos for the animated questions and animated answers (check out the pics above for an example),PowerPoint file with video/slides embedded, questions sheet, game guide for the leader, and Pollsters logo slide.</em></p>

Name: Thanksgiving Feast
Description: Thanksgiving is an incredible time to celebrate what God has been doing this past year and you can help facilitate that in your group by having a Thanksgiving Feast. This isn't just a meal, but is a time of teaching, activity, and community connection. This download includes an event guide, creative ideas, free game, and a message on thankfulness.
Tags: family dinner | feast | friendsgiving | ministry event | thankful | thanksfulness | thanksgiving

Name: Thank You Notes
Description:
3 Different Thank You notes for your ministry volunteers, ready to be printed, cut, signed and delivered! You can cover the logo on the back to drop in your own ministry or church logo, so that your volunteers know that these came from you. After you print off these double-sided, 2-up cards, trim off the edges and fold them in half. These thank you notes are designed to fit into a small standard envelope (each card when trimmed and folded is about 4'x5.25'). There is space for a handwritten message from you to each of your leaders to make it personal!

Included in this digital download are the PSD files, AI files, and PDF files to generate three different Thank You notes.

Name: Thank You Cards
Description: Various 'Thank You' card graphics to be used to send to students or volunteers. Great way to show appreciation to those in your ministry. Come fully editable.

Name: Teal Summer Calendar 2019
Description: Use this customizable calendar to organize your summer! Hand it out to student or mail it home to parents to remind them of everything coming up this summer. You can customize colors on dates and coordinate with your list for each month. Add your own subscription number to the bottom to remind parents and students to subscribe to your updates.
Notes: Thank you for your order!

Name: Teaching Feedback Form
Description: One of the best ways to grow as a teacher of God's Word is to receive constructive feedback from other believers. This two-page teaching feedback form serves as a helpful tool to develop your content and delivery as a teacher. Give this form to a trusted volunteer, mentor, pastor, or another mature believer to provide you with honest feedback and pinpoint areas for growth. It helps to find someone who is a gifted listener!
Tags: admin tools | Sermon | teaching | youth leader

Name: Tattoos, Booze, and All the Taboos
Description:
Do you ever feel like there are some things you just can’t talk about? What does the bible really say about the taboo? In this series we break down the context of tattoos, piercings, alcohol, drugs, and even the LGBTQIA community, and how to respond to the world.

Week One // Tattoos and Piercings
Week Two // Alcohol and Drugs
Week Three // LGBTQ Community and the Church
Week Four // You Asked For It (no notes included, let your students decide the topic)

What this product includes: 3 weeks of message notes and small group questions, 4 instagram devotional graphics, and 4 presentation slide graphics for each week.

Name: Take the Lead
Description:
As Christians, we are all representatives of Christ. Whether we like it or not, as Christians that means we have influence over those around us. Because we have influence, we are leaders for Christ. We need to be taught how to lead. Saying it is one thing but knowing how to do it is another. This leadership series looks at different characteristics of leaders and how they need to be applied to our life and the way we lead. If we truly do these things, God will make a huge impact through His people in this world. This 8 week series is great resource as it can be used for a sermon series, small group series, or student leadership curriculum. It has a teaching overview guide that is shell for helping you design your teachings and spark ideas to help with writers block. Each week has several questions to dive into each topic to tear apart that specific leadership quality. This resource is perfect to help introduce the topic of leadership to the next generation!

This resource includes:
- Teaching overview guide for 8 weeks
- 8 weeks of group questions
- Presentation graphics
- Social media promo graphics
Tags: focus | Humility | lead | leadership | listen | pride | student leadership

Name: Survive the Haunted House
Description:
Celebrate the Halloween season with your group exploring a haunted house all on a screen. This house is not normal and you have to decide what you must do to survive based on 3 options.

1 - Have someone read the scenario out loud.
2 - Play as either a group or individual and choose
OPTION A - Left Side of the Room
OPTION B - Stay in the Middle
OPTION C - Right Side of the Room
3 - The scenarios increase in difficulty over time
4 - Good luck!

Can you survive the 8-rooms of the Haunted House?!

The slides come as jpegs and a PowerPoint file. You don't need a special program to run this screen game!

In this youth ministry Summer Calendar download package, you get the Photoshop version and a version built in Microsoft Word. This 3 month Summer calendar runs from June to August.

We’ve also included 3 background options to choose from, all ready to go, to make this calendar re-usable in future semesters, make it monthly, or just for different tastes! Description: This product contains both a PSD file and a Word doc file. Design varies slightly, but both are designed in 5 x 8 sizes so that you can print two to a page and cut right down the middle. Name: Stylish Printable Prayer Journal
Description:
We passed out this prayer journal at a girls ministry event about how to effectively pray. It has a full-color designed cover, and cute (but cheap to print) pages for each part of the ACTS Method: Adoration/Worship, Confession, Thanksgiving, and Supplication/Requests. It also has 3 pages of scripture for personal struggles: Character, Self Image, and Worry. All pages come in PDF and Word format (to add more personal struggles if desired) and are full of scriptures about each topic. Students can easily walk through their prayer time each day using the sheets. I recommend putting them in a 3-ring binder and including notebook paper in between each category to write their prayers and any specific requests to remember each day.

The matching lesson is available to make this a full girls ministry event! (Girl Talk - Dear Dad: Talking to God)

&nbsp;

*Attention: This product requires Adobe Photoshop to edit or another compatible program

Name: STUFFED: 3 week sermon series (Thanksgiving)
Description:
STUFFED: 3 week series (Thanksgiving)

Stuffed:
Sometimes we just don't want to wait. We sneak a cookie when mom isn't looking. Maybe grab a Burrito at Taco Bell on the way to Thanksgiving dinner. We end stuffed to the point of nausea. The danger of too much of something in our lives is that it leads to being ungrateful. And God has created us to be a grateful people!

Session One: Grateful
Session Two: Bucket List
Session Three: Critical Spirit

This series includes:
- Title slide and a scripture slide
- Count down the days instagram pics (i.e. 3days until...) to build anticipation
- 3 instagram pics per session that is either a scripture or main idea from the previous session. It helps the message to stick throughout the week.
- Some weeks include prop ideas and/or worship elements
- Also Small group discussion questions

Name: Students and the Church
Description:
This message is a one-off sermon for the whole church; a challenge to the church body as a whole to view students as an important part of the church of today, as well as be challenged in the role each person plays in guiding young people's faith formation.

Building from Galatians 5:5, this message looks at four factors in particular that help young people plug into the faith for the long haul.
1. They have meaningful adult Christian relationships.
2. Attend intergenerational religious services weekly or more.
3. Currently involved in a religious youth group.
4. Prays and reads scripture twice a week or more.

How to use this product:
Play this game in PowerPoint or other software using the JPG images.
This or That: This game can be played where all students are involved by going to the right or left side of the room depending on which answer they think is correct. If they are wrong, they sit down. The last person standing wins.
Individual: It can also be played with an individual score sheet by writing down their answers and then switching the answer sheets with another to mark which ones are right and which ones are wrong. Answer Sheet word document is included. NOTE: When playing this way, make sure to arrange the slides with all questions, then go over the answers.

Name: Straight Outta Context
Description:
The Bible is full of scripture that is often taken out of context. In this three-part series, we pull three of the worst offenders and discuss what they are actually telling us.

Series includes:
- Sermon text in Google Docs and Microsoft Word formats
- Title slide

Name: Stay Woke
Description:
<strong>Stay Woke</strong> - If you frequent social media, you likely have come across posts that are tagged #staywoke. Woke is a slang term derived from the word “awake.” We use the word awake or awoke when we are talking about physical sleep. “I was sleeping, then I awoke.” Woke has a similar definition, but instead of talking about physical sleep the slang term is used for awareness on current events, social issues, and injustice. If you were to say to someone, “Stay woke!” often, you are telling them to stop dreaming or living in a fantasy and see the real world.

The series Stay Woke is intentionally playing off this slang term to encourage students to see how their Christian beliefs are in tension with what the surrounding culture is saying. Every week a topic is presented and we first will look at what our culture tells us and then what Scripture says. Utilizing the tension between our culture and Scripture, we conclude by telling our students to Stay Woke and recognize that Scripture and contemporary culture disagree on some major issues in our life.

<strong>INCLUDES: </strong>Word for word manuscripts, PPT files, slides for every week, and graphics.

<strong>3 word for word message transcripts with overview outlines (15 pages)</strong>
- WEEK 1 - There is only one Jesus and we know Him by His Word
- WEEK 2 - Your identity is found only in Christ
- WEEK 3 - God is at work in you and through you

Name: Stay in Shape
Description: We often practice things to get better at them, whether a sport, an instrument, or some other skill. But when it comes to our spiritual lives, we almost seem to be okay with spending one day a week, really only a couple hours a week, growing. This one-off message helps highlight the importance of Spiritual Disciplines and making the necessary time to grow and develop spiritually, not just physically.

This video download is a perfect tool to build engagement before your service begins. It’s a 5-minute countdown, but at least once a minute, the timer fades away to reveal a would you rather question related to the famous movie franchise from a galaxy far, far away. It’ll get your group into their seats, talking with those around them, and ready for your service to begin. It’s great for a youth group, but it also can be great for kids' ministry!

Name: Squad Goals
Description:
In a world where relationships have changed, our students are growing up relating to one another very differently. In the past 25 years, the average person experiences loneliness more frequently and has less close friends than ever before. But, the Bible speaks often to friendships.

This series seeks to help students to understand what it is to be a Godly, Biblical friend. It also helps them to understand what they should look for in a friend.

Week 1 - Love Like Jesus
Week 2 - Being a friend from Proverbs
Week 3 - Carrying each other's burdens
Week 4 - Cutting off toxic relationships

This series comes complete with full manuscripts that also includes suggested illustrations and presentation notes. Each manuscript also comes in both .doc and .pages format so you can edit it as you need. There are two versions of a series logo slide for you to choose from, as well as a background for your slide notes.

Also included is an optional survey to give your students prior to the series to understand their view of friends and how they interact with their friends.

Description:
This discipleship study is a great tool to use to disciple/mentor students with! Each week, there is a new discipline to look over and discuss how to apply that discipline to your walk with Jesus. &nbsp;

Name: Speed Gaming
Sound F/X Game
Description: This game is played a bit like charades, but with sound effects. The goal of the game is for one team to guess the most words as their team makes the sounds. For example, the word “lion” appears on the screen behind the team representative and their team instantly starts roaring. The team rep then has to guess what they are making the noise in reference to which, in this case, would be lion.
Excerpt: This game is played a bit like charades, but with sound effects! A great team game without all the running around, but still causes a commotion!
Tags: cats | computer game | dogs | effects | fx | games | propresenter | screen game | screen games | slides | sound effects | sounds

Description:
This 4 week series talks about understanding what it takes for us to be a community of disciples, from working alongside the community, properly treating other Christians, knowing what a disciple is, and then finally some tools to make more disciples.

<strong>This series contains:</strong>
4 Sermons
- Know Your Team (Community)
- Learning to Build (6 Marks of a Disciple)
- Building Others (Treating Other Christians Respectful)
- Teaching Others to Build (Making Disciples)

PSD Editable Series Logo (And corresponding JPEG premade)

Each month, we release a full month's worth of images, with a suggested caption to go along with it and a schedule of what to post, when. It's designed to give you a consistent social media presence, with minimal work, and one that can then be supplemented with live posts from your events and gatherings.

This pack contains 10 .jpeg's and a .pdf of suggested captions. In our normal, monthly packs, we also include .psd's for greater customization. Even better, our monthly packs are completely free for our Level Up members.

Name: So, Now What? New Believer's Devotional
Description: This 7-day devotional takes the new believer on a journey to discover more about what salvation is, why it is necessary, and how to live out this new faith in Jesus Christ. The new believer will have space to write, answer questions, follow prayer prompts, read and reflect on Scripture. This resource is written in such a way as to be able to print into a booklet format.
Excerpt: This 7-day devotional takes the new believer on a journey to discover more about what salvation is, why it is necessary, and how to live out this new faith in Jesus Christ.
Tags: Christian | devotional | Devotions | Disciple | Followers of Jesus | Jesus Christ | New Believers | Now What | Salvation

Name: Snap That - Fall Edition snapchat game
Description:
The way students connect on social media is far different from how they connect in the physical world. Odds are, best friends may have completely different stories to view on snap chat based on who they follow and who they actually interact with. But most likely, our feeds still look very familiar. For whatever reason, you know that over time as you go on social media, you’re going to see someone posting about being at a sporting event you aren’t at, and you’ll see someone posting a picture of their perfectly framed devotional time in the morning, and someone is going to be posting a screenshot of a funny conversation they just had.

Snap that gets your students to race through their feeds to find some of these stereotypical things, and a few not so easy to find ones, in teams to win. It’s a super simple game to play and has been a HUGE hit with our groups, because of how simple it is 'Find this in someones story, and show it to a leader.'

This brand new game contains 11 game slides in .png format so you can insert it in your presentation software easily. It also comes with a pre-made powerpoint presentation that is ready to go, so you can download this game and play it instantly. Grab this game today and play it tonight!
Tags: Back to School | fall games | game | group game | phone game | snapchat

Name: Smartphone Facts
Description: Do you have students who love their cell phones? Do you find that they never move their face away from those screens? Well, for a few moments help them look up and away from their phone to test their knowledge on the very thing that they hold in their hand. Fun and simple game with ridiculous facts about smartphones. May the arguing of Apple vs Android begin!

Name: Small Group Starter Kit
Small Group Leader Announcement Cards (will witkovsky)
Description:
Small Group Leader/Volunteer Announcement card. Give these cards to your volunteers and/or small group leaders to remind them of announcements to share in their small group time. They can also be used to give to students. What we suggest you put on the card:
-A Fun Riddle, Joke, or Fact
-Announcements
-A quick Bible verse or some practical ways to live the Christian life

They are fully customizable and are 5.5x2.5. Can easily be printed on card stock or paper of choice.

Name: Slang Game 2
Description:
Slang game is a screen game that is sure to get your students laughing and engaged. We found it best to play this game using adult leaders, or for parents when doing a parent night. In this game, players will be shown a popular gen z slang term, and must correctly define it. This download contains 11 new gen z terms for players to define.

This game has 11 rounds, so there’s always a tiebreaker, and can be used in a number of different formats for your group. You can play with one volunteer up front trying to get 8 out of 11 correct for a prize, you can have two teams face against each other, you can have a different player each round for a small prize. Like all of our games, it comes with individual images for you to insert into your presentation software of choice, but it also comes as a preloaded powerpoint and keynote for you to plug and play quickly.
Tags: gen z | leaders play | screen game | upfront game

Name: Slang game 1920s edition
Description:
Slang game is a screen game that is sure to get your students laughing and engaged. Unlike the other two rounds, this game is great for anyone to play. We all know a few gen z lingo terms, but now that we're heading into the 2020's, how many of us can define the slang from 100 years ago? In this game, players will be shown a popular slang term from the 1920's, and must correctly define it.

This game has 11 rounds, so there’s always a tiebreaker, and can be used in a number of different formats for your group. You can play with one volunteer up front trying to get 8 out of 11 correct for a prize, you can have two teams face against each other, you can have a different player each round for a small prize. Name: Short Stories Halloween Edition
Description:
Last year, we released an awesome new game for youth ministries called <a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/downloads/short-stories/">short stories</a>. Our groups loved playing it so much, we knew we’d have to make a <a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/downloads/short-stories-christmas-movie-edition/">Christmas version</a>, and now we've got a brand new halloween edition!

If you haven’t played Short stories, we take movies and tell the story in just 5 words. We dont just describe the movie in 5 words, we give you the story. Some movies are tougher to decipher than others, but theres a great mix of easy and brutal in this download.

This package contains 11 “questions,” or short stories of movies, with 11 answer slides. Plus, we’ve put it into a powerpoint presentation so you can just download it and play it instantly. You’re going to love this game, and you’re students will, too!

Name: Short Stories - Christmas movie edition
Description:
A few weeks ago, we released an awesome new game for youth ministries called <a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/downloads/short-stories/">short stories</a>. Our groups loved playing it so much, we knew we'd have to make a Christmas version for our upcoming Christmas Parties, so we're sharing it with you!

If you haven't played Short stories, we take movies and tell the story in just 5 words. We dont just describe the movie in 5 words, we give you the story. Some movies are tougher to decipher than others, but theres a great mix of easy and brutal in this download.

This package contains 11 'questions,' or short stories of movies, with 11 answer slides. Plus, we've put it into a powerpoint presentation so you can just download it and play it instantly. You're going to love this game, and you're students will, too!

Name: Short Stories
Description:
This game is sure to be a classic and is inspired by a great game from Jimmy Fallon.

You can either play this game as a competition between two teams, or have one player come up and try and go through the gauntlet for a great prize.

The game involves deciphering what movie is being told through a short story. The challenge is that when we say short, we mean 5 words. We're not just talking about random adjectives for the movie, but legitimate short, 5 word versions of real stories from movies.

Any movie buff in your group will love the challenge of this game, but it also features movies made in the last 2 years (or obvious classics) so that the majority of students in jr. or sr. high would be able to know the movie.

Download this great game today!
Tags: movie game | Powerpoint | screen game | upfront game

ShapeShifter

Sent
Description:
This one-off message will challenge students to take the call of being sent into the world as disciples of Christ more seriously. This lesson includes harsh statistics about Christianity in America, and seeks to inspire students to own their faith. Being sent into the world is talked about a lot in church, but what does that mean for students? This resource includes:
• Message Manuscript (.Doc)
• Sent Small Group Questions

• Social Media Slide

Name: SENT
Description:
This three-Week Series takes students through a few key passages in Paul's letter to the Romans with an emphasis on evangelism. This series is designed to challenge to recognize that they are being SENT to share the good news of Jesus with the world.

INCLUDES:
3 message transcripts
PSD and JPG series graphics
Bumper Video
Instagram graphic/video
Snapchat graphic/video
Blank sermon slides

Name: Semester Teaching Bundle (3-series)
Description:
Our hope is that this teaching bundle will help you communicate God’s Word to your students powerfully over the next few months. You can always find this and other great resources at YouthMin.org.

This 6-Month Lesson Bundle includes the following:

<strong>-ALL OF ME SERIES (6 WEEKS)</strong> This series focuses on giving God every part of ourselves. Often, we keep certain parts of our lives to ourselves and don’t really let God affect them. Money, sex, relationships, social media...how can I give these areas to God so He can have ALL OF ME?

Series includes:

-6 Word documents / lesson outlines
-Editable PSD files for banners, posters, and projection
-6 Weeks of discussion questions for your small group leaders
-Facebook InfoGraphics for social media lesson
-Editable PowerPoint presentation “Living Biblically Online.”

<strong>-BOURNE TO DIE: THE JESUS LEGACY (5 WEEKS)</strong> Colossians 1:15-20 makes it clear that Jesus is supreme, unlike anyone else. This series focuses on the supremacy of Christ and His unmatchable character. He is Redeemer, Creator, all-powerful, and the image of the invisible God.

Series includes:

-5 Word documents / lesson outlines
-Editable PSD files for banners, posters, and projection
-5 Weeks of discussion questions for your small group leaders

<strong>-CURES FOR THE CHRISTIAN BLAHS (9 WEEKS)</strong> We have all experienced the Christian Blahs at some point. We feel apathetic, distant from God, and we wonder how to get our spiritual fervor back. This series focuses on helping students find a way through the Christian Blahs. How can we find our way back to the passionate pursuit of Christ?

Series includes:

-9 Word documents / lesson outlines
-Editable PSD file for posters (can be adapted for other purposes)
-Editable PowerPoint slide
- Overview of the Cures for the Christian Blahs

Description:
We may follow different people on Instagram, but most likely, our feeds still look very familiar. For whatever reason, you know that overtime you go on Instagram, you’re going to see someone posting about being at a sporting event you aren’t at, and you’ll see someone posting a picture of their perfectly framed devotional time in the morning, and someone is going to be posting a screenshot of a funny conversation they just had.

Scattergram gets your students to race through their feeds to find some of these stereotypical pictures, and a few not so easy to find ones, in teams to win. It’s a super simple game to play and has been a HUGE hit with our groups.

This brand new Halloween edition contains 11 new game slides in .png format so you can insert it in your presentation software easily. It also comes with a pre-made powerpoint presentation that is ready to go, so you can download this game and play it instantly. Grab this game today and play it tonight!
Tags: everyone plays game | group game | interactive game | screen game

Excerpt: A great one night exegetical message on being the Salt&amp;Light that God calls us to be!

Name: Sacred Sermon Series
Description:
God instructed Moses how to design the sacred space that he would meet with him in, the Tabernacle. It was an intricate, purposeful design, built by people wired for craftsmanship, and created with all its vestiges for the honor of God. Sex is a similar thing, a sacred, intimate space given to us by God with purposeful designs, helping us live out who we are made to be, and to be used for God's glory and not our own gain.

This series will look at the end of the book of Exodus, to see how the Tabernacle can be a metaphor for the intimacy of sex. Each week steps into a delicate conversation, providing you a sermon manuscript, small group questions, recommended reading, screen backgrounds and instagram graphics. Also included is a parent letter that you can modify and send out to help explain the teaching that is going to be covered.

Week 1: Sex &amp; Intimacy
Week 2: Gender &amp; Attraction
Week 3: Honor &amp; Beauty
Tags: backgrounds | exodus | graphics | Moses | Old Testament | Sermon Series

Name: Sacred Secular
Description:
In the world today, we tend to divide our Christianity from the rest of the world. As we see in Scripture, that is not what men and women of Christ are called to do. Taking two weeks, Sacred Secular looks at how we should take our sacred life in Christ and apply it to the secular things we are involved in. As followers of Christ, we should seek to engage the culture of this world with our Christian values and this series will lead students through that!

Week 1: Engaging Culture - Jeremiah 29:4-13
Week 2: Work as Worship - Daniel 3:1-30

&nbsp;
Excerpt:
This resource includes:
- 2 manuscripts
- 2 weeks of small group lessons
- Presentation graphics
- Social media graphics
Tags: culture | Daniel | engage | Jeremiah | Sacred | Secular | Sermon Series | youth leader

Name: Rethinking Discipleship
Description:
If you are looking to re-evaluate how you do discipleship in your ministry, then this is the perfect resource for you! Even if you are already actively engaging in discipleship, but need to recast the vision to your leaders, parents, and students then check this download out!

<strong>Leader Training</strong>
These resources are intended to be used to train your leaders in the vision of discipleship. You can use them to speak to parents, volunteers, or even your staff.

1. Discipleship Leader Training (volunteer leader training)
2. Discipleship Framework Training (volunteer leader training)
3. Helping Students in Crisis (volunteer leader training)

<strong>Messages</strong>
These two messages could be delivered to students or adults to cast the vision of what discipleship looks like in the local church.

1. The Priority of Discipleship (word-for-word manuscript)
2. The Process of Discipleship (word-for-word manuscript)

<strong>Discipleship Tools</strong>
These are tools that you can provide for your leaders to either help in their volunteering or to setup discipleship relationships.

1. How to Counsel a Student Visualization (leader handout)
2. Counseling a Student (leader handout or lesson)
3. Fast Tips on Discipleship (leader handout or lesson)

Name: Resurrection Easter Series
Description: Why do we only talk about the resurrection on Easter? Paul seems to think we should not just talk about the resurrection of Jesus one day a year, but we should live IN the resurrection daily. This download is a three week sermon series that is designed to be kicked off around Easter time.

Name: Restart
Description:
This four week sermon series is a great way to kick off a new year or school year. How can we start off on the right track? Ultimately, when our relationship with God tackles some of the issues that we all face.

This topical series will lead your students through four different words that begin with RE and challenge them to dig deeper into their relationship with Christ to kick off the new year or school year.

Week 1 - Repentance
Week 2 - Remaining
Week 3 - Reviving
Week 4 - Restoring

This series comes complete with Pages and .doc manuscripts with some built in discussion questions, as well as prompts for any slides you may want to use. Title slides and background slides are also included.

Name: Resolve - 4 Week Youth Ministry Small Group Curriculum
RESET Theme / Retreat Design Package
Renovated in Jesus: A Journey Through Colossians
Description:
In the Book of Colossians, we see that as followers of Jesus we need to be continually renovated in Him. As an old house gets a renovation done to look new, we are called to go through a renovation process daily to be new in Jesus. This series is a 4-week journey through the Book of Colossians teaching students on how they can be renovated in Jesus.

Week 1: Colossians 1 - Our new life with Jesus
Week 2: Colossians 2 - Live alive in Christ
Week 3: Colossians 3 - Put on your new clothes
Week 4: Colossians 4 - Follow Jesus' plan to life

This resource includes:
- 4-weeks of manuscripts
- 4-weeks of small group questions
- Graphics for presentations
- Graphics for social media promotions
- 4-weeks of social media recap graphics

Name: reGeneration Sermon Series
Description:
This series is called reGeneration, because it is about discovering a new way of life.  It is a study of the book of Romans, touching on many doctrines and deeper teachings from this book.   We want students to see that there is a different way to live that is better than the ways of this world.  We hope your students will discover that this new life is better life, too.  They don’t have to live by the old way of life, the life that leads to destruction.  We want them to know that they have the choice to live in a whole different direction.

This Sermon series includes 5 Sermons in PDF and DOCX formats, Sermon Series promotional graphics (Instagram, Facebook, Flyers) as well as slide backgrounds, PLUS a set of 6 lessons for small groups or Sunday School classes to coordinate each week with the sermon series.  Each lesson includes a teachers guide in PDF and DOCX formats, handouts for students in that document, and several creative activities and games to go along with the lessons.

Name: Redemption
Description: This 3-part series walks students clearly through the Gospel. Beginning with the problem of sin, the price Jesus paid for our sins, and finally the outcome of it all and what it looks like to be a true follower of Jesus Christ.
Tags: Forgiveness | Gospel | Gospel Message | Jesus | Payment | Problem | Redemption | Sin | Solution | The Gospel

Name: Recruiting Goals Worksheets
Description:
OVERVIEW:

Tired of feeling like you are doing everything? Sometimes it just takes asking the right questions to help you identify what you need help with.  These tools are designed to help you identify your immediate volunteer needs and set goals.

Includes:

--Critical Needs Assessment

--Volunteer Needs Worksheet

--Goals Worksheet
Excerpt: A series of worksheets and forms to walk you through identifying your immediate volunteer recruiting needs and setting goals to meet them.
Notes: Thank you for your purchase! I hope you find this resource helpful in keeping track of your recruiting endeavors. For more tips and recruiting best-practices, catch my blog on YouthMin.org   Blessings, Mandy Lucas

Name: Reality Sermon / Retreat Design Package
Description:
This world offers a lot of false realities. But the most important reality is that God loves us, and He sent His Son to die in our place. To communicate this truth, we have created a set of theme graphics designed to help you share the “reality” of God’s love and sacrifice for us. This package includes the graphic design elements for your “identity” retreat - Posters, Logos, Teaching Slide Backgrounds, Tshirt Designs, and more. You will receive editable Photoshop and Illustrator files (you will need Photoshop and / or Illustrator to edit them). Happy downloading!

<em>NOTE: You are downloading Illustrator and Photoshop files. You will need Photoshop / Illustrator to edit the files. There are JPEGS and PDF files to use if you do not have these programs.</em>

Name: Produce | Fruit of the Spirit
Description:
Produce is an eight-week small group series that attempts to activate students to the reality of producing fruit in their lives. The Fruit of the Spirit are marks of a Christ-like character. A believer filled with God's Spirit will not just do the things of Christ, but will be at the very heart a person whose life models the God he serves.

This 8-part teaching series looks at aspects of the Fruit of the Spirit from Galatians 5:22, examining each fruit so that the whole character of the Fruitful Christian becomes clear. Are you living a life that others are craving?

In this purchase, you will receive:

- Eight 2-3 page small group guides
- WEEK 1 - Produce: Introduction
- WEEK 2 - Love
- WEEK 3 - Joy
- WEEK 4 - Peace/Patience
- WEEK 5 - Kindness/Goodness
- WEEK 6 - Faithfulness
- WEEK 7 - Gentleness
- WEEK 8 - Self-control
- Series graphic slide for ProPresenter or PPT

<a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/vendor/jholmes/">Click here to find more resources from Jonathan.</a>

Name: Prodigal Son Message
Description: This message was designed to show students the amazing grace and mercy of their father in heaven. I believe the father is the main character of the prodigal son story and it is demonstrated in the way he approaches both of his sons with grace and mercy right where they are. Students see that they have been shown grace and mercy right where we are and the Father approaches us with grace and love. Included are my sermon notes, a title slide, and a background slide.

Name: Poorly Explained Movies vol. 2
Description:
Poorly Explained Movies is exactly what it sounds like, movies that a good majority of your group should recognize, but explained in a really bad way. For instance, your group might not want to watch a movie about a first time sailor trying to return a necklace to it’s rightful owner, but you would when you realize thats just Moana.

This game has 11 rounds, so there’s always a tiebreaker, and can be used in a number of different formats for your group. You can play with one volunteer up front trying to get 8 out of 11 correct for a prize, you can have two teams face against each other, you can have a different player each round for a small prize. Like all of our games, it comes with individual images for you to insert into your presentation software of choice, but it also comes as a preloaded powerpoint and keynote for you to plug and play quickly.

Description:

Description:
This calendar is great and simple for any size Youth Ministry.

At YouthMin.org, we firmly believe having a great looking calendar is essential for your ministry, for a number of reasons. For starters, it helps show parents you are organized when you can show them what is coming up months down the road. It also helps make events easier to remember when the calendar is something they actually want to look at.

With this download, you'll get an incredible looking calendar for a great price and be able to look like you hired a professional to do it for you. What's even better, is this calendar isn't just editable on Photoshop, but there is also a Microsoft Word version as well!

Download today and you can edit it tonight to hand out this weekend.

This great business card template can be used for a number of purposes, from helping connect parents with small group leaders, to promoting services, to using as scripture memory cards.

Super easy to edit in photoshop, download it today!

Name: Polygonal Branding Package
Description:
This is the perfect package to help kick off your school year in great style.

This package will help families tie in what your student ministry is doing, since all the resources follow the same design pattern, but they also help communicate great information for your ministry.

With this package you'll get:

<a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/downloads/polygonal-business-card/">The Youth Ministry Business card</a>, A great tool with plenty of ways to use.

Description:

Each round starts with a heavily pixelated image, moves to a moderately pixelated image, and ends with the clear, fully enhanced image. Students, either as up front volunteers competing, or as teams, must correctly identify the image, and get a point for each stage before fully enhanced they can identify it in.

This edition of pixelated focuses on video games, from consoles to mobile.

This download comes with 11 rounds of images, each with 3 iterations of the image, all as individual slides for easy upload to pro presenter or similar software. It also comes preloaded and ready to go in a powerpoint presentation and as a keynote presentation for Macs.

Name: Parent email kit
Description:
How often do we hear, or even say, that youth ministry should partner with parents?

But what does that actually look like?

Too often, we can get caught up in the busyness of ministry that we don't do the things we want to do, that we know we should do - like partner with parents.

There is far more to partnering with parents than just this resource, but this kit goes a long way in helping us move our ministries from simply sending home a newsletter informing parents of what we're doing, to a place where we are building connections and ministry moments with parents.

This download comes with 5 trench tested, pre-made emails that are ready to go for different situations that come up all the time in youth ministry. But more than just ready to go emails for parents, it's a guide meant to help you enhance your overall email strategy, and tailor fit your why and how behind the emails to make them really work for you.

The best part is, you don't need any software. The emails come in a word document for easy copy and pasting, and the guide is a .pdf.

Description:
Many times parents come to you looking for help on a specific topic. And it's never just one at a time, there's always multiple topics that need to be covered. Parents in today's world are looking for help when it comes to raising their teens. They want their kids to follow Christ, but in a culture that doesn't always agree with what the Bible teaches, it can be difficult.

Sometimes, parents just struggle with specific topics and want to be more informed. Or maybe, there's just a specific need that is happening that you want to share with your parents in order to strengthen their family.

This pack has four fully editable Parent Chats covering topics that are relevant to parents in your church.

These four chats cover:

Leading Your Family In Faith At Home
Unsocial Media: How technology is changing our relationships
How to get your kid to talk when they won't talk to you
Let's talk about sex and dating

The content has been created, the research has been done, and now you can strengthen your families in the topics that they're looking to learn about.

&nbsp;

<em><strong>But Wait! This resource is also part of YouthMin.org's Ultimate Youth Ministry bundle! While you're more than welcome to purchase this resource individually, you can grab it as part of our massive resource pack that saves over 94%! Grab this, and an additional 100+ resources!</strong></em>

Name: Parent Chats
Description:
I'm a big believer that one of the best things a Youth Pastor can do for the growth of their student ministry is keep open lines of communication with Parents. It's just way to easy to see that the long-term health of a group is connected to parent buy-in.

One way to keep great communication with parents is to simply call them! In today's day, we'd much rather text, but calls are a lot easier and take only a minute or so, and go a long way with building greater parent connections.

This resource is designed to help you do that, even using an easy and natural cause for the call - transitions. With spring coming, you've got a handful of students who will be moving from 5th grade into your middle school ministry, students moving from 8th to 9th grade, and students graduating. If you called no one else but these parents, you'd still see a great return on the investment of time!

So download this pack of parent chats! It contains 5 total scripts you can easily edit and customize, and use yourself as well as pass on to your leaders to use as well. Scripts for students transitioning in or out of your ministry, for families who visit your church on Sunday, and a letter template to send to parents introducing yourself!

<strong>Grab it today and start improving your parent ministry!</strong>

You have the chance to put another adult in the life of someone’s son or daughter. Two combined influences are greater, stronger, more powerful than anything either of us could do alone.

This event will work not only in student ministries but also children ministries. Included in this kit:

Name: Ordinarily Star Wars Edition
Description:
Ordinarily is a game that basically gets the order right!

This is a screen game, that is half trivia and half common sense. On each slide, four lists will be shown of the same items, just in different orders. Players must determine which list is sequenced correctly based on the criteria given on the slide. Players cast their vote based on the color under the correct list. Included in this game are 10 questions and answers, plus a sample question and answer, and a title slide.

There are several ways to play this. You can call up a handful of players to participate, and on each question, only those who get the correct answer can stay for the next question and those who got it wrong get replaced with new players. You can have players give their answer by saying the color, showing the color from a set of papers you hand them, running to someplace in the room that has that color and pointing to it or moving to a designated spot in the room for each color. You can even have savage eliminations by letting only the first person to reach the correct spot in the room stay in for the next round. Give a prize to the people with the most right answers, or to the people who lasted the longest without getting eliminated!

Name: No Apologies
Description: This is a four-week series comparing and contrasting other beliefs to Christianity. In this series we discuss Atheism &amp; Agnosticism, Jehovah's Witnesses, Mormonism, &amp; Islam. The thrust of this message is not to blow our students heads up but to promote loving others and teaching our students that the Gospel transforms people, not our knowledge of other people's faith. Also included are JPGs &amp; PSDs of the graphics as well as all the sermon notes plus resources for further study and to help you contextualize your message better.

Name: Next: Why Jesus?
Description:
?
We know teenagers wrestle with questions such as:

Was Jesus even a real person?
Did Jesus really claim he was God?
How is Jesus different than other “wise” teachers?
Why did people follow Jesus?
Is Jesus actually important to the Christian faith?
In this edition of Next, Why Jesus?, we’ll help your students process these questions.

A note from the writing team about Why Jesus?–

Right up front, we have to say that this topic is really big and difficult to rightly handle. We hope to see our students grasp the importance of Jesus within the larger story of God’s extravagant love for us. God in the flesh, Jesus, comes to earth to reveal himself further to humanity is a story that at once gives us goosebumps and brings us to a place of repentant gratitude. “For God so loved the world” echoes throughout time and space as a calling into this amazing relationship with that same God and the freedom of a life in Christ.

Keep in mind that the teachings tend toward an oversimplification of many of the issues that Christian apologists do cover with more depth. We cannot possibly touch on every aspect of why Jesus is so important to the Christian faith, but what we can do we have done. We are greatly influence by the likes of N.T. Wright, Ravi Zacharias, Lee Strobel and others. You may also notice that we have left out Jesus as the propitiation for sin in this lesson, mostly because we feel that this is a topic unto itself and could not possibly be handled within the framework of the other burning questions our students have concerning Jesus. The main issues addressed by us are the exclusive claims of Jesus, the historicity of Jesus, the importance of the resurrection, and the incarnation of Christ.

We strongly recommend that you create a box where students can write down and submit questions as you go along. It’s very likely they will be addressed at some point in the series, but this way you will know where your students are at in the process and you can tailor the lessons to them.

We are sure you can add to this list. We also know that there are no pat answers to any of these questions that will satisfy students long term. The most effective way to answer them is to allow students to experience the truth for themselves through a number of means. We strongly recommend that the curriculum prompts that include scripture, prayer, and discussion be utilized, but all that is up to you.

One of our foundational beliefs is that the Holy Spirit does the work of convincing. We encourage you and your team to lean into that belief as well. Our job is not to argue anyone into the Kingdom or to berate another’s beliefs, but to present better questions, the testimony of people, and the scriptures.

This packet includes:

Student Leadership Meeting
Four Topical Lessons with Small Group Questions
About Next

Long gone are the days of shallow and pat answers that have been common in our teaching. Students today live in a complex world and our teaching must rise to the occasion and help guide them through the maze of culture’s complexities. Brock Morgan, along with this dream team of authors and thinkers, have put together what we believe is NEXT in youth ministry teaching and engagement. Through, in a more holistic manner, addressing the topics that are key in a student’s burgeoning faith we have crafted a series that will direct investigation and appeal to the heart. Connected to The Amazing Next Conference, this series is meant to empower students and to help them have a sustainable faith that lasts; a faith that is thoughtful and engaged in what God is doing in the world.
<div class='grammarly-disable-indicator'></div>
<div class='grammarly-disable-indicator'></div>

Name: Next: Why Church?
Description:
If you are aware of the statistics that have gone around the last few years, you are probably as troubled by the Church drop out rate as we are.  Our students are finding that the local body of believers is often at odds with their rapidly shifting culture.  Once they begin to experience life outside the Christian “bubble” of their childhood, they begin to realize that the world is a diverse and highly relational place.  This section of curriculum tackles two issues for our students: The relational realities of their world which is in seeming conflict with the Church and the purpose of the Church community in their lives.

First, our students actually know someone who is gay, they are friends with someone who is Muslim, they are smart enough to see what war does to entire people groups.  They have relational skin in this game and are becoming more and more aware of the lack of compassion that seems to spew from those who speak for the American Church in the news.

The second issue many of them face is that their church does not usher them into adulthood, but rather ignores them and relegates them to the youth ministry.  They do not feel part of something bigger than themselves, with purpose and meaning they can buy into. As a result they are not seeking to be a part of a Church community until years after high school graduation or sometimes not at all.

We hope that the scriptures found in these lessons will bring about a counter cultural revolution in your group.  The teachings of Jesus were revolutionary in his own day and carry the same weight in these uncertain times.  And, let’s face it, loving God with our whole being and loving others well is stinking hard.  But we believe our students are up for the challenge and the Church should be both the launching pad and home base for those desiring to live a flourishing life in Christ.

<strong>This download includes:</strong>
Student Leadership Meeting
Four Topical Lessons with Small Group Questions
Slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, ProPresenter, MediaShout, etc
About Next

Series Authors
Brock Morgan plus themed lessons from: Brian Cress, Chuck Hunt, Mark Helsel, Leah Knight, Danny Kwon, Paul Martin, Kelsey Morgan, and Mark Riddle

Name: Next: The Gospel Reframed
Description:
The word “gospel” has drifted a long way from its original meaning or has almost no meaning to today’s youth. All too often we speak of the gospel to students when they have no real understanding of the term or the theological framework it sits in. Because we, as followers of Jesus, acknowledge the transformative power of the gospel we feel compelled to make the gospel accessible to this generation.

If the gospel is so powerful, what is it that makes it so? What does it mean to a student, or anyone, living in this day and age? What, if anything, makes it “good”? These are the questions that we hope to address in this curriculum as we paint a picture of the term “gospel” within its context and hold it up as a beacon of hope to those living today.

We also pray that your students will go through this curriculum gaining a better understanding of the gospel for themselves, for humanity, and for all of creation. We believe that the gospel is, in an age where there are so many competing philosophies and religions, just as valid and relevant today as it was for the first won converts.

You may notice what some would see as a gaping hole in this curriculum on the gospel – the topic of hell. Though hell is scriptural, we are convinced that it has been overemphasized and mishandled by well-meaning teachers to either scare students into heaven or pressure them into evangelizing out of fear. Personally, what brought me into abundant life in Christ was not hell, but God’s incredible love and forgiveness -God’s amazing Grace. We, instead, choose to come from a Kingdom of God framework that emphasizes the overarching purpose and plan of God for humanity and the world. Ephesians 1: 9-10 (NIV) says it this way:

“…he made known to us the mystery of his will according to his good pleasure, which he purposed in Christ, to be put into effect when the times reach their fulfillment—to bring unity to all things in heaven and on earth under Christ.”

We strongly recommend that you create a box where students can write down and submit questions as you go along. It’s very likely they will be addressed at some point in the series, but this way you will know where your students are at in the process and you can tailor the lessons to them.

We are sure you can add to this list. We also know that there are no pat answers to any of these questions that will satisfy students long term. The most effective way to answer them is to allow students to experience the truth for themselves through a number of means. We strongly recommend that the curriculum prompts that include scripture, prayer, and discussion be utilized, but all that is up to you.

One of our foundational beliefs is that the Holy Spirit does the work of convincing. We encourage you and your team to lean into that belief as well. Our job is not to argue anyone into the Kingdom or to berate another’s beliefs, but to present better questions, the testimony of people, and the scriptures.

This packet includes:

Student Leadership Meeting
Four Topical Lessons with Small Group Questions
Slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, ProPresenter, MediaShout, etc
About Next

Long gone are the days of shallow and pat answers that have been common in our teaching. Students today live in a complex world and our teaching must rise to the occasion and help guide them through the maze of culture’s complexities. Brock Morgan, along with this dream team of authors and thinkers, have put together what we believe is NEXT in youth ministry teaching and engagement. Through, in a more holistic manner, addressing the topics that are key in a student’s burgeoning faith we have crafted a series that will direct investigation and appeal to the heart. Connected to The Amazing Next Conference, this series is meant to empower students and to help them have a sustainable faith that lasts; a faith that is thoughtful and engaged in what God is doing in the world.

Series Authors

We have brought together some amazing authors, who are veterans in ministry and really smart!

Brock Morgan plus themed lessons from: Brian Cress, Chuck Hunt, Mark Helsel, Leah Knight, Danny Kwon, Paul Martin, Kelsey Morgan, and Mark Riddle

Name: Next: Supernatural
Description:
Students today are searching. They are searching for ways to explain the unexplainable, define the undefinable, and put words and methods to a God who is omnipotent, omniscient, and omnipresent, words that we can hardly grasp. In a time where we worship a wanderlust mentality, how do we settle down long enough to form a foundational faith in something we cannot see?

These four weeks we’re going to talk about where our society is today on the topic of engaging the supernatural. What is easy to believe and what is hard to believe? Why are we searching, and what are we ultimately searching for? Then we’ll talk about how we might be more supernatural than we have ever really understood, what exactly makes God “super natural”, and how we can reconcile ourselves to him in the midst of it all.

In a day where anything goes, every belief is acceptable, and anything can have power, how do we know who has the real power?

We encourage you to spend time during the first week finding out where your students are at on this topic. What have they encountered in their search, or their friends’ search for understanding and faith? Meet them there.

We strongly recommend that you create a box where students can write down and submit questions as you go along. It’s very likely they will be addressed at some point in the series, but this way you will know where your students are at in the process and you can tailor the lessons to them.

We are sure you can add to this list. We also know that there are not pat answers to any of these questions that will satisfy students long term. The most effective way to answer them is to allow students to experience the truth for themselves through a number of means. We strongly recommend that the curriculum prompts that include scripture, prayer, and discussion be utilized, but all that is up to you.

One of our foundational beliefs is that the Holy Spirit does the work of convincing. We encourage you and your team to lean into that belief as well. Our job is not to argue anyone into the Kingdom or to berate another’s beliefs, but to present better questions, the testimony of people, and the scriptures.

This download includes:

Student Leadership Meeting
Four Topical Lessons with Small Group Questions
Slide templates for PowerPoint, Keynote, ProPresenter, MediaShout, etc
About Next

Long gone are the days of shallow and pat answers that have been common in our teaching. Name: NEXT Sermon Series
Description:
This is a 4 week sermon series that looks at Biblical examples of leadership that comes from the next generation. The first week is written to be used for a service for the entire church, speaking to the importance of students getting a chance to lead in the church. (It was used for a Graduation Sunday service). Additional weeks can be used for to speak to teens or to the church.

Sermon topics include:
• Joshua (calling)
• Phinehas (passion)
• Esther (timeliness)
• Timothy (mentoring)

Also included in this series are sermon graphics (3 background slides and an Instagram image) and small group questions for the last 3 sermons.

Name: Next: Science & Faith
Description:
Can a Real Scientist Believe in God?

The narrative today seems to suggest that science and faith are in conflict. This lesson focuses on exploring the reality that if we take the time to deeply understand science and faith, we can learn the ways in which they complement and differ from each other. We want to help students navigate the felt tension between science and faith guided by Scripture, discussion, and God’s spirit.

Some of the most pertinent questions are:

Can I love science and love God?
Does science disprove Christianity?
Why does the church seem to hate scientific facts?
Do I have to choose between science and faith?
We strongly recommend that you create a box where students can write down and submit questions as you go along. It’s very likely they will be addressed at some point in the series, but this way you will know where your students are at in the process and you can tailor the lessons to them.

We are sure you can add to this list. We also know that there are not pat answers to any of these questions that will satisfy students long term. The most effective way to answer them is to allow students to experience the truth for themselves through a number of means. Name: Next: Racism
Description:
Does racism really exist in our culture?
How do I have a conversation with someone when I don’t understand their point of view?
Am I impacted by my culture’s attitudes about race?
What, if anything, can I do about racism?
Whew! There is no way to address this topic adequately, especially in the limited time and space we have on a youth group night. Hopefully Eniitan’s lessons and stories will help spark conversation and so much compassion among your students. We truly believe that the next generation will have a better handle on this than those that have come before, but it is important to connect their faith with the cry of the marginalized. Unity, not sameness, is the crux of the early church. Our faith is one in which every tribe, tongue, and nation come together through the equalizing and transformative power of Jesus Christ.

We strongly recommend that you create a box where students can write down and submit questions as you go along. It’s very likely they will be addressed at some point in the series, but this way you will know where your students are at in the process and you can tailor the lessons to them.

We are sure you can add to this list. We also know that there are not pat answers to any of these questions that will satisfy students long term. The most effective way to answer them is to allow students to experience the truth for themselves through a number of means. We strongly recommend that the curriculum prompts that include scripture, prayer, and discussion be utilized, but all that is up to you.

One of our foundational beliefs is that the Holy Spirit does the work of convincing. We encourage you and your team to lean into that belief as well. Our job is not to argue anyone into the Kingdom or to berate another’s beliefs, but to present better questions, the testimony of people, and the scriptures.

Student Leadership Meeting

Graphic slides for use in your favorite display program
About Next

Connected to The Amazing Next Conference, this series is meant to empower students and to help them have a sustainable faith that lasts; a faith that is thoughtful and engaged in what God is doing in the world.

Edition Author

Eniitan “Eni” Coker is a first generation Nigerian-American born as the youngest of 7 kids and raised by a dynamic and God-loving Nigerian mother in the deep South of the U.S. “Eni-” translates to person and “-itan” is equivalent to the English words history or story. All together, Eniitan is by name a “person with a history” or “child of story” and by practice, a storyteller. Her nuanced upbringing in Georgia as a Nigerian raised in African-American culture but consistently positioned in predominately white environments is woven into the narratives of the curriculum. Eni’s calling to youth ministry that led her to the Northern Virginia has allowed her unexpected opportunities to explore what God has to say about issues of race, class, socioeconomic status and multi-ethnic ministry. This curriculum stems out of lived experiences, racial literacy courses, shared narratives, uncomfortable conversations, heart-breaking memories and hope-filled vision that has been held up to the word of God and the nature God.

Index of Themes

(Each theme covers 4 weeks and 1 student leadership lesson = 5 lessons/theme)

Evil and Suffering
Sexuality
Racism
Gifted and Called
Science and Faith
The Gospel Reframed
A Dismissed Faith
Why Church
Why Jesus
Supernatural

Name: Next: Gifted & Called
Description:
Our students are extraordinary! We believe that this is true, even in the midst of their pain, mistakes, and general adolescent drama. And that is the beauty of our gracious God- the he not only can use us for his glory, but he has chosen to give gifts to his people so that they can be fully alive as his image bearers. As students learn that they are called to join God here on earth in his master plan to renew and restore all things, we hope that they will begin to value themselves, their decisions, and the rest of humanity.

Our students will wrestle with questions such as:

How do I define success?
What am I passionate about?
What does God want me to be or do?
What are my gifts?
During this series we will introduce the term “Royal Priesthood” to the students. This may seem a bit archaic, but it might also resonate with stories from popular culture that seem to capture the imagination. If students are really ready for a life worth living and are tired of sitting in rows and only hearing about the faith, then this is a title that will stir their hearts and minds. We draw from the picture of Jesus, the servant King and Priest, who we are still talking about and emulating over 2000 years later. We call students into their role as co-heirs with Jesus, partners in making all things new in the here and now.

We have given you several tests and inventories to have your students fill out and immediately you might think, “Yuck! Tests!” Before you toss these out consider that it is our experience that kids love anything that is about themselves, so we encourage you to do your best to lead them through this process. So much of our relationship and how we connect with God has to do with our identity and personality, and so it is fun to explore this arena with students.

The great news is that you can refer back to these. Spend extra time where you feel they are resonating and We strongly recommend that you create a box where students can write down and submit questions as you go along. It’s very likely they will be addressed at some point in the series, but this way you will know where your students are at in the process and you can tailor the lessons to them.

We are sure you can add to this list. We also know that there are not pat answers to any of these questions that will satisfy students long term. The most effective way to answer them is to allow students to experience the truth for themselves through a number of means. We strongly recommend that the curriculum prompts that include scripture, prayer, and discussion be utilized, but all that is up to you.

One of our foundational beliefs is that the Holy Spirit does the work of convincing. We encourage you and your team to lean into that belief as well. Our job is not to argue anyone into the Kingdom or to berate another’s beliefs, but to present better questions, the testimony of people, and the scriptures.

Name: Next: Evil and Suffering
Description:
Today’s student really struggles with evil and suffering. With the advent of the internet, we are able to see our world in a whole new light. The problems that we used to be aware of in our neighborhoods, communities, states, or nation have now paled in comparison to the evil and suffering found in the world that we are now able to access. This poses a specific set of questions for young people about God’s role in the world and in their own life. These questions, if not expressed in a loving and faith filled community can become stumbling blocks in the growth of a teen’s faith.

Some of the most pertinent questions are:

Why would a loving God allow people to suffer?
Why doesn’t God make evil people stop what they are doing?
There are so many terrible things going on in the world, how can I make a difference?
If God allows evil to exist in the world, does that make him evil too?
We strongly recommend that you create a box where students can write down and submit questions as you go along. It’s very likely they will be addressed at some point in the series, but this way you will know where your students are at in the process and you can tailor the lessons to them.

We are sure you can add to this list. We also know that there are not pat answers to any of these questions that will satisfy students long term. The most effective way to answer them is to allow students to experience the truth for themselves through a number of means. We strongly recommend that the curriculum prompts that include scripture, prayer, and discussion be utilized, but all that is up to you.

One of our foundational beliefs is that the Holy Spirit does the work of convincing. We encourage you and your team to lean into that belief as well. Our job is not to argue anyone into the Kingdom or to berate another’s beliefs, but to present better questions, the testimony of people, and the scriptures.
