Name: Next: A Dismissed Faith
Description:
In September of 2006 George Barna sent a shockwave through the Church and particularly youth ministries. The study released by the Barna Group stated that “61% of today’s young adults . . . had been churched at one point during their teen years but they are now spiritually disengaged (i.e., not actively attending church, reading the Bible, or praying). Only one-fifth of twenty-somethings (20%) have maintained a level of spiritual activity consistent with their high school experiences.” (source) The statistic is shocking and disheartening to churches that purport to be making disciples. Barna goes on to report, “Another one-fifth of teens (19%) were never significantly reached by a Christian community of faith during their teens and have remained disconnected from the Christian faith.” There have been other follow-up studies that are providing more in-depth information. The “Soul Searching” study was completed by Christian Smith and The National Study of Youth and Religion. The Sticky Faith Study was completed by Kara Powell and the Center for Youth and Family Ministries through Fuller Seminary. Each have had follow ups and are asking the question: Why are teens walking away from faith?

Our faith is steeped in both intellectual assent and mystery, so it is no wonder that our students are questioning the validity of having faith in Christ. Those who lean into the intellect struggle with the mystery and those who lean toward spirituality miss the ancient historical narrative that grounds the Christian faith. We believe that students need to embrace both realms in a more holistic manner in order to have flourishing life in Christ. But let’s be honest: none of this is new.

There are age old questions that every follower of Jesus has had to grapple with:

What do we really know about Jesus?
How do I have faith when everyone around me is saying it is just a crutch or so flawed that it is stupid to believe?
Why do I even need God?
We strongly recommend that you create a box where students can write down and submit questions as you go along. It’s very likely they will be addressed at some point in the series, but this way you will know where your students are at in the process and you can tailor the lessons to them.

We are sure you can add to this list. We also know that there are not pat answers to any of these questions that will satisfy students long term. The most effective way to answer them is to allow students to experience the truth for themselves through a number of means. We strongly recommend that the curriculum prompts that include scripture, prayer, and discussion be utilized, but all that is up to you.

One of our foundational beliefs is that the Holy Spirit does the work of convincing. We encourage you and your team to lean into that belief as well. Our job is not to argue anyone into the Kingdom or to berate another’s beliefs, but to present better questions, the testimony of people, and the scriptures.

Name: New Years Eve Lock-in Graphics
Description:
Fully editable graphics to promote your New Years Eve Lock-in. This file contains graphics formatted for Facebook event headers, Instragram pics, and a full-page flyer. Edit the text to drop your church name in, your specific details for your lock-in, and you're ready to go!

This digital download includes three Photoshop .PSD files, three .PNG samples, and an Illustrator .AI file with all graphic formats.

The font used in the graphic text is Novecento Wide, available from http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/novecento-wide. You can edit the text on each graphic in the PS and AI files to connect the series to your program or customize it to a specific detail.

Name: New Student follow up pack
New semester launch plan
New Believers Coffee Talks Next Steps
Description:
This is a resource designed to give your leaders tools for mentoring students. This specific pack is a 12 week pack of conversation guides to help students discuss faith and grow in their walk with God. These aren't lengthy discussion guides, but rather, a little bit of prep for leaders revolving around 1 question to discuss with a student in a one on one setting.

<strong>In this download pack:</strong>

8 weeks designed for students who have <a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/downloads/new-believer-coffee-talks/">completed the first 12 week plan</a>. This is a great strategy for helping students get connected to the group, to a leader, learn about small groups, and move from brand new Christian to having a good understanding of what that means, and this session of discussions will help students learn how grow their faith and take practical steps in learning how to pray and how to study the Bible.

1question may not seem like much, but it's designed to lead to further discussion. What we DIDN'T want was to have leaders sitting in starbucks with a stack of papers they are reading, never looking at the student. We aimed for one focus for the week that would give a general framework for the conversation, that is part of a larger plan to help move students from point A to point B in their spiritual Journey.

This resource is a great tool for your ministry, either as is or as a starting board for something else.
Tags: conversation guide | discipleship | growth | mentor | new believer | next steps | small group leaders

Name: Nerf Wars Youth Group Event Poster
Description:
Download this extremely easy to edit poster to advertise for your next Nerf event.

Contains photoshop file for standard paper size flyer which can also be scaled for invite cards or powerpoint announcements.

Name: Nerf Wars Youth Group Event flat poster
Description:
Download this grey design to promote a nerf wars event night! All of the design files are included to customize this in a matter of minutes and start printing, and it's scalable, so you can create handouts, invites, and powerpoint slides to match the them!

Download contains Photoshop files.

Name: Nerf Wars Battle Royale event guide
Description:
Our youth ministry recently held a nerf wars with the battle royale game mode, and it was a huge success. We've included a walk through guide of how we did it, with some extra tips we learned along the way, so you can pull off an event like this for your youth ministry!

This download also comes with a set of graphics you can customize and use to help promote your event!

Name: Names of God Teaching Series - 11 weeks
Name this thing volume 2
Description:
Name this thing is a great game for nostalgia. We like to play games for the sake of fun, but when they can be used to teach points (or help drive points home) then it’s even better. We used these games to help talk about how fleeting pursuits outside of God can be, the idea of the things that were the absolute coolest (just 10 years ago in some cases) and now aren’t even known. There’s plenty of other points you can use this game, and the others like it, to help teach.

This game comes with 11 question slides and 11 answer slides, plus a premade powerpoint with the game ready to go, so you can download it and play it tonight!

Name: Name this show
Description:
Name this show is a game in the same style as <a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/downloads/name-this-thing/">Name this thing</a> and <a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/downloads/name-this-thing-volume-2/">Name this thing 2</a>, in which students have to remember things from slightly before their childhood.

In Name this show, players need to correctly name 11 different shows that are Iconic for the generation just before them. It's a great game to bring up small group leaders to play to win a prize for their group.

This download comes with 11 rounds of images, each with questions and answers, all as individual slides for easy upload to pro presenter or similar software. It also comes preloaded and ready to go in a powerpoint presentation and as a keynote presentation for Macs.

<em><a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/youthmin.org/permalink/2086061064746417/">Level Up members</a> save 35% on all orders, and get many resources, including this one, for free.</em>

Name: Name that Stache
Description:
This game is just pure fun. Nothing says “manly” like a great mustache. This game offers students the opportunity to identify some well-known celebrities by their incredible mustache. Simply show the mustache and see if students can identify who it belongs to. Works great as an upfront game to kick off a fun night at youth group.

This is a PowerPoint file, and easily editable or capable of being added to. Enjoy!

Name: Name that Patty
Description:
Need a game for St Patrick's Day? Download this 'Name that Patty' burger themed game. Can your students guess what burger goes with what restaurant?

Download Includes:

.JPG files for ProPresenter or Power Point

Name: Name that Movie: Disney Emoji
Description:
Do you have what it takes to guess your favorite Disney Movies by Emoji's? Download this powerpoint game that includes 11 Disney Movies.

Product includes: Powerpoint File and Slide .jpg's

Name: Name That Gang
Description:
Have you ever noticed that some of the most ordinary animals have some of the weirdest names when they are grouped together? Scientists had a ton of fun naming groups of animals and your group can have fun with animal group names too by playing Name That Gang!

INSTRUCTIONS
1 // The name of a group of animals will appear in the middle of the screen and four answers will appear in the corners.
2 // Choose the animal that you think has that group name by walking to the corresponding corner of the room.
3 // Example round...What is a pod? A group of... A) Snakes B) Snails C) Whales D) Tigers

The slides come as jpegs and a PowerPoint file. There is also a psd of the title slide if you would like to edit it yourself in Photoshop. You don't need a special program to run this screen game!

Name: Name that Candy
Description:
This is an incredible game that will work great at both Halloween and Christmas, when candy is literally (not literally) all over.

In this game, contestants will compete to correctly identify a candy based on a small taste, while blindfolded, and being fed by a partner. This download contains the graphics to support it, and a list of candies to buy to run the game.

Name: Mystery Blender
Description:
Need a gross, fun, upfront volunteer game? 
Mystery Blender is a relatively easy to set up and fun game that your students will be talking about for weeks. 

Included in this package are:
- Detailed instructions (included recommended shopping lists and stage set up)
- Editable screen graphics ready to go or edit for 720p or 1080p screens

Note that this game does require a trip to the store and a blender

Name: My Bubble
Description:
My Bubble is a single message with this as its' goal:

Proverbs 13:20; Matthew 9:9-13; and more!

We are called to go out of our way and to remember our mission with our relationships

This download comes with the series graphics, word for word manuscript, and PowerPoint slides.

Name: Mountaintop Experience
Description: This download is a one-off message that attempts to teach students the importance of following Jesus, not a feeling. Events can give us these mountaintop experiences that aren't sustainable. Following Jesus doesn't always lead you to the top, but rather through the valley.
Tags: feelings | following jesus | Mountain top | the valley

Name: Mountain Moving Prayer
Description: What would be true of the world if God answered your prayers? The goal of this one-off message is to help students understand the power of prayer and begin praying with expectation because God answers prayer!
Excerpt: Do we believe prayer is powerful?
Tags: Answered Prayer | Powerful Prayer | prayer | Sermon Series | Standalone

Name: Motion Transitions: Volume 2
Description:
Take your service from siesta to fiesta. With these transitions you can eliminate dead time and your students will never wonder what's going on.

What this product includes: a motion transition for announcements, game time, offering, small groups, countdown, and a welcome animation.

Name: Motion Transitions Vol. 3 - Fall Badges
Description:
Bring on the spirit of fall with these motion transitions that are designed to make your program slides run smooth.

Animations Included: Announcements, Offering, Welcome, Small Groups, Game Time, See You Next Week, and a 3 minute Countdown.

Name: Most Likely to be a Celebrity
Description:
Here's a screen game that has a little fun with some famous celebrity yearbook photos! Players will be shown a set of yearbook photos, and they have to guess which picture is of someone who made it as a celebrity! Each of the 10 rounds even includes a slide with a clue to help out!

This download includes HD photos of each slide, as well as a powerpoint show with all slides included.

Name: Moose, Meese, Moosen
Description:
Test the language skills of your group with this great new game that asks for the correct plural form of words.
Some of these answers may blow your mind, some may cause great debate in your group, but these are all the true, correct forms of plural, even if other forms are acceptable in proper english (for example, Octopuses and Octopi are both acceptable, but the correct plural form is Octopodes. Look it up).

This download contains an example question and answer, and 11 question slides with 11 answer slides. It comes prepackaged into Powerpoint so you can download and play today!

Name: Missing Pieces
Description:
Today's students struggle with identity. So many of them don't know who they are, even when they are found in Christ. But the Bible identifies who we are in Christ. This series seeks to help students battle against some of the major issues that are facing Generation Z, feeding them a false image, and help them stand secure in their identity.

<strong>Week 1</strong> focuses on our value found in God, and seen through Christ's death.

<strong>Week 2</strong> helps us battle against wanting to be accepted by others, showing us that our acceptance is found in Christ.

<strong>Week 3</strong> looks at our need to belong, but that the greatest belonging is found in Christ. But, we also understand that following Jesus shows us that there are times we will never belong in the world.

<strong>Week 4</strong> examines our purpose, that is found only in knowing God and keeping His commands.

And the final week will look at the way Scripture identifies us as followers of Christ and the blessings that come from being found in Him.

This series is complete with graphics for teaching, as well as full manuscripts with notes and suggested illustrations in both Pages and .doc format.

&nbsp;

Name: Memory: What's in the room?
Description:
How well can your group recall details of an image?

In this game, we'll show you a room for 10 seconds, then ask you to recall a detail from that room. Can your group do it?

What's extra great about this game, it can be played with images, it can be played as a pure video based game, or it can be a hybrid. We include each round as a full video to transition from one to the next, but we also include just the video with the timer for each round, and you can manually click forward to the question and answer, and we include just the images with no video/timer. Whatever works for your group, this game works for you!

Name: MemeMe - Halloween Edition
Description: Meme Me is a hilarious game that your students will love! You can play this as an up-front game with a few or put students into groups to come up with their best caption as a group. The game is simple - show the pictures and give students a time limit to come up with their best caption. Then award the team with the best captions with the prize! This package includes PNG files of the title slide, as well as all the other slides. In addition, there is a PowerPoint file for easy use or editing to add your own slides.

Name: Meme Me - Thanksgiving Edition
Meme Me
Description:
Meme Me is a Think Fast and Funny Frenzy Game designed to keep your youth group cracking up. Meme Me is a write-your-own meme game that will allow your students to use their creativity. Gameplay looks like this: Bring a few students on stage and give them each a small whiteboard and marker (or paper and marker if need be). Each round, players will be shown a picture and challenged to write their own meme or caption. They will have 30 seconds to think up and write their meme. After the time is up, have the players read their meme to the crowd, and then vote using the applause of the audience. First player to 3 wins!

You could also play with groups coming up with their best meme and presenting their best answer and having an impartial judge choose the winner.

The Meme Me package includes 11 slides with hilarious pictures for your students to caption. Each slide is a PNG built at 720p.

Description:
Sometimes, you wrestle with including a game or giving more time for another element in your ministry programming. We started creating these countdown videos that serve as more than just a timer, but also include elements to engage your group as a game would.

This video download is a perfect tool to build engagement before your service begins. It’s a 5-minute countdown, but at least once a minute, the timer fades away to reveal a would you rather question related to the the cinematic universe of our favorite superheroes. It’ll get your group into their seats, talking with those around them, and ready for your service to begin. It’s great for a youth group, but it also can be great for kids' ministry!

Name: Marvel Or Meh!
Description:
In this screen game, your students will have the opportunity to guess if the quote is a Marvel Cinematic Universe movies quote or that the quote belongs to that "other" comic book company (DC). This game can work with selected contestants or the entire group.

Pro-Tip: use the included printable cards with the Marvel logo and Meh for DC on for students to hold up the correct answer. This helps reduce the amount of cheating that can occur. Or they students can hold up an "M" like in signing the YMCA for Marvel or shrug their shoulders for Meh. Another option would be to use the provided answer sheets for the entire group to use at once (Note: you'll need to rearrange the slides to make this happen - all questions and then the answers).

Includes in this game:
• PowerPoint [PPT]
• 10 Questions and Answers [JPG and PPT]
• 1 Tie Breaker Question and Answer [JPG and PPT]
• 1 Blank Slide, 1 Emmet Brickowski Answer, and 1 Doc Emmett Brown [JPG and PPT]
• Answer Sheet [Word &amp; PDF]
• Marvel or Meh Answer Card [Word &amp; PDF]

How to use this product:
Play this game in PowerPoint or other software using the JPG images. There is an answer sheet or cards for your usage. These can be used in various ways including:

Head to Head: This game can be played head to head where two students go against one another until one wins the game.
Individual: It can also be played with an individual score sheet by writing down their answers and then switching the answer sheets with another to mark which ones are right and which one are wrong. Answer Sheet word document is included. You can also play with cards included and have them raise the correct answer with the photo of the Emmet or Emmett of their choice.

Graphic Logo Information:
Presentation size: 16x9 at 1920x1080. Font: Bebas &amp; Guthen Bloots
Excerpt:

Name: Major Stuff from the Minor Prophets
Description:
The minor prophets tend to be forgotten -- their books are short and their messages can be glossed over in favor of the big names like Jeremiah or Isaiah. But their messages are just as important today as they were when they were written! This 9-week series goes into each of the Minor Prophets, what messages they were instructed to give, and what that means for us today.

This series includes
- Title slides for each sermon
- Original PSD file
- Sermon text in Google Docs and Microsoft Word formats

Name: Magnetic Teaching Series
Description:
God has called us to seek and save the lost, to make disciples of all nations. The most effective and powerful way we can do that is by reflecting the character, grace, and truth of Jesus Christ in our everyday life. When we look like Jesus, we stand out from the world, and the world takes notice. Living a life that imitates Jesus, in short, makes us “magnetic.”

This 9-week series explores attributes of our Heavenly Father that we can add to our lives in an effort to be magnetic and attract those around us to Jesus. Each week explores a different characteristic that we should be seeking to add to our lives.

Series includes:

-9 complete sermon manuscripts (editable / Microsoft Word)
-9 sermon manuscripts (non-editable PDF)
-Sermon graphics including the following:
-6x4 Banner Design (PSD and JPEG)
-Projection Image (HD) - 720p (PSD and JPEG) and 1080p (JPEG)
-Homepage image - 1920x692
-Instagram image (square, ready to post)

<em>Note: You are downloading PSD files - to edit those files, you will need Photoshop or an alternative program.</em>

The question of the matter is, will we seek that thrill in God or be deceived and fall into sin? This series explores how we can go onto the Godly adventures we are called and live a life of purpose and Kingdom filled.

- Week 1: The Step into Adventure
- Week 2: Preparing for the Adventure
- Week 3: Detours on the Adventure
- Week 4: Giving the Adventure Away

Name: Life, the Universe & Everything
Description:
Life, the Universe &amp; Everything is a three week message series that tackles some of the toughest questions. The issue of faith and science is one that the church has not had a great history with; it’s one of the main reasons young people give for leaving the faith after high school. Using some of the latest research, as well as quotes from the Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy and Doctor Who, this series attempts to give students a new framework for reconciling faith and science, while at the same time exploring the core message of scripture.
Week One, “The Ultimate Question,” challenges students to consider whether we are asking the right questions of scripture when we address the topic of faith and science. This message also addresses the core purpose of scripture: to guide us to God.
Week Two, “Don’t Panic,” takes a deep look at Genesis 1, four different theories of origin, and how Christians can approach Genesis 1 in a way that honors God.
Week Three, “Mostly Harmless,” explores Genesis 2, the creation of Adam and Eve, the Garden of Eden, and what scripture teaches us about the nature of humanity and its origins.
This series draws heavily on current research and Biblical experts for guidance. It is not a series that advocates for one approach to interpretation (e.g., young earth, old earth, etc.), rather, it challenges listeners to a different path, one in which we can have unity in faith while having different approaches to questions regarding science.
Includes:
• 3 Manuscripts
• 3 PowerPoint presentations
• 3 Handouts with discussion questions
• Graphics package, including social media images
Excerpt: A three week series exploring the ultimate questions of creation, origins, the nature of humanity, science and faith! Includes manuscripts, PowerPoint presentations, handouts with discussion questions, and a graphics package.

Name: Lego Trivia
Description:
Did you know that if every Lego piece in existence was divvied up evenly, it would be enough to give every person alive on the planet 80 bricks? Did you also know that means you could build a tower to the moon 10 times out of just legos? Well, if you download this game, you'll know these crazy facts and more about the worlds #1 toy. This game is great for any lego themed nights your youth ministry might be planning, or for National Lego Day in January!

This download contains 20 game slides (10 questions with 10 answers) and a powerpoint presentation preloaded so you can download and play this great game with your youth ministry!

Name: Lego Backgrounds
Description: Download this great set of HD Lego Backgrounds! 6 different slides with different colors, that will be great for using with a lego themed night, game, or talk!

Name: Legacy
Description:
It’s not a matter of “if” we will have a legacy; it’s more a question of what that legacy will look like and how it will impact others. This video highlights people whose legacies are the greatest in history, and points out that every legacy worth remembering revolves around devotion to someone/something much bigger than that person.

<a href='https://youthmin.local:8890/vendor/sampettersen'>Check out more products from Sam Pettersen here</a>

Name: Leftovers
Description:
We all have many things competing for our attention and devotion, and if we're not careful we can end up giving God our "leftovers". This was His complaint with Israel in Malachi 1; in this message we learn why this happened, and how to prevent it in our own lives.

You'll get:
- Message transcript in Microsoft Word format
- Title slide
- Blank content slide
- Instagram and Twitter graphics

Name: Left or Right - one off message
Description:
This is a one off salvation message that challenges students to reflect on where they are on their walk. This message focuses on Luke 23:39-43 and which criminal we are, are we the one on the 'Left or Right'?

Shortly after my grandmother passed away and I was reading the gospel of Luke and was given the realization, in the end there are only two things that matter and they are represented in the crucifixion of Jesus. There is one criminal that is focused on the world and doesn't believe or trust Jesus, on the other side of Jesus there is a criminal that is equally as sinful yet there is one major difference, he trusts Jesus, he chooses to follow Jesus. What is Jesus' response to him?

Includes:

Message transcript
Message graphic
PowerPoint (Google Slides) Presentation

You can check out more of my stuff at: https://youthmin.local:8890/vendor/th3pr1de/

Name: Leaders Training Event
Description:
This download is for a family ministry leaders training event.

When we did it, we had all volunteers that had anything to do with family ministries (birth-college) come together, and we used it for the beginning of the year each year. This pack contains all the graphics you would need to invite all your leaders and make it a well attended event, and an overview schedule. It doesn't contain the actual meeting notes, since most of that was specific to our church and your church probably has its own that you can fill in quite easily from looking at the schedule
Tags: children's ministry | leaders | small group leaders | training

Name: Leader Training
Description: This 3-part series focuses on training your volunteers in the area of Bible study and teaching. Unlike many youth pastors, our volunteers are not trained to study Scripture and present it in the way it should be presented. This resource focuses on 3 aspects of teaching: the authority of Scripture, how to study the Bible, and different teaching methods.

Name: Leader 5 T-Shirt Bundle

Description:

Your group will face life threatening situations such as running out of oxygen while scuba diving, coming face to face with a vicious dog, or foiling an alien invasion. You know, every day stuff!

This game involves the entire group, and is great for groups of 3-3000, and with each question will whittle down the remaining survivors to find who can be the last one standing!

Download contains 11 questions, with 22 game play slides in .png form to upload into presentation software. Game also comes preloaded into a powerpoint presentation so you can download and play today.

Name: Last Man Standing - Jungle Escape
Description:
A fantastic new game that is both practical and fun! This game helps students learn how to escape real life situations, such as how to jump over a waterfall when it's your only way to rescue if you're lost in the jungle after an airplane crash. You know, every day stuff!

This game involves the entire group, and is great for groups of 3-3000, and with each question will whittle down the remaining survivors to find who can be the last one standing!

Download contains 11 questions, with 25 game play slides in .png form to upload into presentation software. Game also comes preloaded into a powerpoint presentation so you can download and play today.

Description:

This game involves the entire group, and is great for groups of 3-3000, and with each question will whittle down the remaining survivors to find who can be the last one standing!

Tags: everyone plays games | games | group game | screen games

Name: Labels
Description:
Labels is a single message with this as its' goal:

Labels

Genesis 1:26-27; Genesis 2:7: and more!

Your identity is found only in Christ.

This download comes with the series graphics and a word for word manuscript.

Name: Know Your Cereals Game
Kings, Prophecies, and Gifts
Description:
This 3-week series presents a different perspective of the Christmas story, just after the birth of Jesus as told in Matthew 2. Many students have heard the Christmas story, heard about Mary and Joseph and baby Jesus and the shepherds and wise men. This series will still cover all of that, but from a different point of view than we usually go.

This series includes 3 manuscripts, links to resources used, series logos, presentation slides for each week and one that can be used for all 3 weeks, as well as various image resources for teaching.
Excerpt: This 3-week series presents a different perspective of the Christmas story, just after the birth of Jesus as told in Matthew 2. Many students have heard the Christmas story, heard about Mary and Joseph and baby Jesus and the shepherds and wise men. This series will still cover all of that, but from a different point of view than we usually go.
Tags: Book of Matthew | Christmas series | Christmas time | Gifts | Joseph | King Herod | King Jesus | Mary | Matthew 2 | Prophecy | Shepherds | Wise Men

Name: King of Kings series
Description:
We used these talks and coinciding small group conversation guides for a Middle School Vacation Bible School that was 4 days long, but it would also work great as a weekend retreat theme, Youth Group Camp theme, or just a 4 week sermon series.

King of Kings compares attributes of God to things the world offers to show that only God is worthy of sitting on the throne of our hearts and minds, to rule as the King above all kings in our life. Each message relies heavily upon biblical truths to show how God alone is worthy of Honor, how God alone is truly Constant, how God alone is Eternal, and how God alone is truly vital to life.

Small Group lessons with this series were designed as an element before the message, so rather than finish the sermon, they prepare the hearts of the students for the content of the message, and were written so anyone could lead a group, whether a Seminary student or a High Schooler.

This download contains 4 message transcripts in Word format, and 4 sessions of Small Group conversation guides in word format, as well as Series Slide in both photoshop and .png form, as well as 3 options for talk slides in .png form to match the theme.

Name: Killer New Year
Description:
This 4-part teaching series that hopes to speak a biblical voice over the desire many of us have to find this year better than the last. As we look at four different passages in Proverbs, we will look to guide our students away from the pattern of the world to seek betterment through worldly means, and lead them toward the scriptures allowing God’s Word to dictate what makes a truly killer year.

In this purchase, you will receive:

- Four 2-page small group guides
- WEEK 1 - The starting point for a killer new year is a right view of God.
- WEEK 2 - You can't have a killer new year by yourself.
- WEEK 3 - Your year can't change, until your heart changes.
- WEEK 4 - We must rely on God to have a killer new year.
- Series graphic slide for ProPresenter or PPT
- Instagram (1000x1000) graphics for every week (4)
<em>This series was produced with Chris Frakes, Middle School Minister at Wildwood in Norman, OK.</em>

<a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/vendor/jholmes/">Click here to find more resources from Jonathan.</a>

Name: Just Like Us
Description:
The Bible is full of stories of God using people just like us to accomplish His mission and purpose. This 5-lesson series explores 5 different ordinary people in the Bible that God used to do extraordinary things. This download contains a detailed series overview packet, two graphics, and 5 message transcripts focused on the following big ideas:

Week 1 - To help students understand what it takes to live a life of righteousness like Elijah.

Week 2 - To help students grasp the power of living a life of faithfulness to God.

Week 3 - To help students understand that the key to experiencing the fullness of the Christian life is to hold nothing back from Jesus Christ.

Week 4 - Where you are now is not where you will always be (you are not stuck where you are)

Week 5 - The legacy of your life is being built right now
Tags: Bible | Disciples | Jesus followers | Just Like Us | Sermon | Sermon Series | Similar

Name: Jurassic Games: Weight Edition
Description:
What kid didn't grow up loving dinosaurs? Jurassic Games: Weight Edition puts how massive (and how small) some of these prehistoric creatures were into perspective. This game is designed to divide students up into teams where they guess the weight of a dinosaur and then bid on which guess they think is closest.

Accompanied with this game are highly stylized, animated videos of dinosaurs and how they compare to an average sized male.

Name: June Youth Pastor Bundle
June-August Calendar 2017
Description: Need a Calendar for your ministry? Download this Apple PAGES calendar for your ministry. Apple now provides PAGES for free for any mac or iOS device. That's right...you can edit this calendar on your phone! Everything is included to get you going quickly! Easily edit all areas and get your calendar in the hands of your people fast!

Name: Journey: Roadmap to the Cross
Description:
This Easter series is all about the journey Jesus took to the cross. In looking at only a few of these events students will see how the cross was purposeful for Jesus to take away our sin. Lessons include:
- Week 1: Communion
- Week 2: Accepting the Call
- Week 3: Abandoned for Us

This series includes:
- 3 weeks of manuscripts
- 3 weeks of questions for small groups
- Graphics for presentations
- Graphic for Facebook Banner
- Psd Files

Name: Joseph 5 week series
Description:
A look at the life of Joseph, and how it tells us about the greater story that God is telling, and how, like Joseph, our lives can point to God's story as well!

This download contains a detailed series outline, as well as 5 message transcripts, 5 weeks of small group guides, and social graphics with bottom lines for each of the 5 weeks.

The conversations revolve around trusting God regardless of circumstances, redefining what success looks like, waiting on God's timing rather than our own, keeping our hearts from hardening, and forgiveness. Your group will learn a ton in this series, be challenged, and grow from it!

Name: John Sermon Series Graphic Bundle
Description:
Great graphics package for a study on the book of John. Features a modern yet retro look to grab the attention of your audience. Comes with the following:

-Main slide graphic
-2 content slide graphics
-PowerPoint presentation
-Editable PSD files of all three graphics

Font type used: Bebas Neue

Name: Jesus Said What? Sermon Series
Description:
Some of the most shocking things in the Bible came out of the mouth of Jesus. He would often build a crowd, and then say something shocking that would disperse the crowd because what He said was too much for them to handle. But that doesn't change whether or not we should follow those things today. Christ's words, hard or not, are still relevant. This series will challenge your students to know, understand, and follow the hard things that Jesus said.

This series comes complete with both .doc and .pages files with full manuscripts for each message. It also includes .jpeg files of the title slide and a background for presentation notes.
Excerpt:
Four weeks of fully editable sermon manuscripts (pages or .docs)

Title and background slide for presentations

Discussion questions found in manuscripts

Suggested Illustrations

Name: Jesus' Jacked-Up Genealogy
Description:
A one-off message on the genealogy of Jesus found in Matthew 1:1-17.

This message is all about overcoming whatever it is you're struggling with in your past. Teenagers will be encouraged to live life the way they know they are called to, regardless of what their family, or they, have done in the past. Our future doesn't always have to be defined by our past mistakes.

'Just because something bad is in your past, doesn’t mean it has to be in your future! Don’t allow yourself to lose sight of where you’ve come from, and how got you here - Jesus. Don’t ever judge others for what’s in their past! Remember - Just because you hear something, doesn’t mean it’s true!'

Included in the download is the manuscript in WORD. I have also included the Title Slide, verses, and big points in a PowerPoint Presentation.

Name: Jesus is... Student Devotional
Description:
This download includes 9 separate weeks of devotionals with one for Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday or Saturday. They are all a full page in length (if not longer).

<strong>JESUS IS... </strong>
<em>56 pages of student devotionals</em>
1. Jesus is fully man, so we have a sympathizing Savior.
2. Jesus is fully God, so our life and salvation is secure in Him.
3. Jesus is God with us, so we are never alone.
4. Jesus is redeemer, so our punishment has been paid.
5. Jesus is my shepherd, so we are valued and protected.
6. Jesus is the truth, so we should abide in Him.
7. Jesus is the way, so we follow Him.
8. Jesus is King, so we are under His authority and reign.
9. Jesus is Lord, so we obey Him.

Our hope is that this past nine weeks be a foundation for you to know and love your Savior Jesus Christ. As we grow in our knowledge and love for God, may our love for others follow closely.

This download includes nine separate Word documents, a PDF with all of them together, a book cover logo, jpeg Instagram promotional for every week (except for Jesus is the Way, as this was not part of the original series).

Name: Jesus is... Small Group Curriculum
Description:
The purpose of this series is to correct, broaden, and solidify a student’s view of who Jesus is, resulting in knowing and loving God more. We want our students to worship God for who He is, not who we want Him to be. Help your students understand the beauty of our savior by walking them through this small group curriculum that focuses on building the foundation of Christology.

<strong>JESUS IS... </strong>
<em>8 Weeks of Small Group Curriculum</em>
1. Jesus is fully man, so we have a sympathizing Savior.
2. Jesus is fully God, so our life and salvation is secure in Him.
3. Jesus is God with us, so we are never alone.
4. Jesus is redeemer, so our punishment has been paid.
5. Jesus is my shepherd, so we are valued and protected.
6. Jesus is the truth, so we should abide in Him.
7. Jesus is King, so we are under His authority and reign.
8. Jesus is Lord, so we obey Him.

This download includes a full leader guide of 8 weeks on Jesus Is... and graphics for slides and Instagram!

Name: Jesus is King
Description: Jesus is King has become a popular phrase in our culture. How do we take this opportunity as pastors to teach students that this is a biblical phrase, not just a cultural phrase. How can Jesus be the king of your life? King of your time?
Tags: Jesus | jesus is king | kanye | King | last minute message | one off message | single message

Name: Is Evil Really Bad ?? 5 week Series
Description:
Students are leaving Christianity in droves. These lessons on evil attempt to take a novel approach to one of the main reasons people leave Christianity: “the problem of suffering and evil”. The lessons cover the reasons for evil, logical and emotional responses and the solution for evil provided by God, Himself, in the form of Jesus Christ. The topics of what evil is, how it affects us, why it exists and how we should respond to it are covered. There are strong apologetic and pastoral themes throughout.

Each week there are at least four documents for each lesson.
+ THE LESSON PLAN outlines the lesson.
+ THE HANDOUT is a general outline of the lesson with no blanks.
+ THE HANDOUT BLANKS is a general outline of the lesson with fill-in-the blanks.
+ THE DEVO is a 5 lesson devo for the 5 week days after your lesson. It reviews and expands the concepts taught and gently foreshadows the coming lesson.

Name: Into the Wilderness
Description:
“Into the Wilderness” is a series containing stories in Bible of when people went into the wilderness and overcame. Wilderness can defined as a position of disfavor or an uncultivated region. The wilderness stories will help students that may be in the “wilderness” currently and to help them breakthrough. We talk about topics on temptation, running away, being tested, and God revealing himself to us in our struggles in life.

Week 1
Main Point: We are tempted in the wilderness.
Scripture: Matthew 4:1-11

Week 2
Main Point: God will find you in the wilderness.
Scripture: 1 Kings 19:1-19

Week 3
Main Point: God calls us when we are in the wilderness.
Scripture: Exodus 3-4

Name: Internship Starter Pack

Description:
One of the hacks for helping your instagram posts be seen is to always have something in your story. So, we've built a few videos for you to post on your story with announcements that fit any youth group. Things like bring your bible, see you Sunday, etc., designed in 15 second long videos for you to layer on top of in the instagram app.

This pack contains 8 unique videos, each 15 seconds long, and can be used over and over again!
Tags: christmas | games | powerpoint game | upfront game

Name: Instagram story guide
Description:
I really believe that outside of the Bible, social media is one of the single greatest tools we have at our disposal for reaching those far from Christ for His kingdom. Not only that, I believe it's one of the biggest tools we have for growing and discipling those already in our ministry, reaching those who do know God and helping them grow.

But there are still so many churches not using it, and even less youth groups use it consistently or effectively.

This resource was built to help you increase your reach and effectiveness for using social media for a great purpose. And yes, I believe that YOU, no matter the resources you have or the size of your ministry, can have a huge impact online.

This download and the guide contained within will help you work through some easy tips for better results, some great prompts for doing more with instagram, and apps and tools for better looking stories.

Name: Instagram Event Promo Clip
Instagram devotional - January
Description: Start the year off with a devotional for your youth Instagram account. Every day throughout January you will get a highly quality 1080×1080, image. Each contains a Bible verse (mostly in NLT) on a colored background over an image.

Name: Inaction>Action: When Faith Does Not Include Action
Description:
This series is all about when our faith does not include action. We believe in God, but our actions may say otherwise. This 3-week series looks at 3 common ways we can be "Christian Atheists," and discover how we can fight against that. This 3-week journey will help students think about the current state of their faith and how they can grow in a deeper more serious relationship with Christ!

Week 1: When we don't evangelism
Week 2: When we don't forgive
Week 3: When we don't believe in the Church

This resource includes:
- 3 weeks of manuscripts/teaching guides
- 3 weeks of small groups
- Social media graphics
- Presentation graphics
Tags: Christian | church | evangelism | Forgiveness | Sermon Series
Notes:
Thank you for purchasing this series! I hope it is a help to you and your ministry. Praying God moves through this series in your ministry! Craig Groeschel's book, "Christian Atheist," is a good guide for teaching this series!

Through His Grace,
Ben

Description: Youthmin.org presents a brand new game that will get some laughs as you work together and try to spot the imposter. This game goes perfect with a lesson on knowing God's Word or confronting false teaching. Take the challenge and see if your group can spot the imposters!
Tags: Bible | challenge | game | suspenseful | upfront game

Name: Immanuel Christmas Message
Description:
Bonus: Free Game! ‘Christmas Edition of Gorilla, Man, Gun’

One of the most powerful things that you, as the youth pastor, can do is to engage what is currently happening in the student’s world and connect it with the gospel. This lesson attempts to bridge the season of Christmas to the gospel.

Immanuel is a single large group lesson with this as its’ goal:

Immanuel – Christmas Large Group Manusrcipt

Isaiah 7; Matthew 1

'In our service this weekend, our hope is that every student understands the reason they have to celebrate in this busy Christmas season. A proper understanding of Immanuel gives us our reason for celebration.'

This download comes with the series graphics and the 4 page word for word manuscript.

This is a great lesson for a large group teaching time and could easily be adapted for a small group lesson!

Bonus: Editable sample Christmas Party Flow is included in this download!

<a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/vendor/jholmes/">Click here to find more resources from Jonathan.</a>

Name: Image Bearers
Description: God has bestowed his image only on mankind. As image bearers we have a divine responsibility to reflect God’s image to the world. God has also made his image bearers distinct as men and women. When we confuse the different roles God has given men and women, we confuse the image God has called us to reflect to the world. This is a 4-week series on the subject of Biblical Manhood and Womanhood. This series focuses on what it means to be a young man or young woman today as students. It doesn’t dive into issues of marriage or raising kids because that isn’t where most of our students are. This series focuses on what it means to be the young man and young woman God wants them to be today as image bearers. Included are Message Outlines, Graphics, and Slides. Some of the graphics will need Photoshop or similar to edit.

Name: Image
Description: A 4-week series of small group lessons that traces the theme of image through the story line of the Bible.

Name: Hymnology: Praising Jesus Through Hymns
Description:
Hymnology is a series looking at some of the most popular and historic hymns in our Church history. This is a series to teach students about hymns and their scriptural references to help students in their worship and how they can find Jesus in the lyrics. Each person has their own story and each hymn has its own theme. Whatever we go through in life, it's nice to know there are songs out there that we can speak with our lips as prayers to God! Hymns taught over include:
-Week 1: Doxology
-Week 2: 'Tis So Sweet to Trust in Jesus
-Week 3: Hallelujah! What a Savior!
-Week 4: Blessed Assurance

This series includes:
-4 weeks of manuscripts
-4 weeks of small group questions
-Presentation slides for you to create your presentation
-Social media graphics
-Phone background
Tags: Assurance | Blessings | Praise | Sermon Series | Worship

Name: Humility - One-off Message
Description: Pride is something that we all struggle with but are too prideful to admit. In this message we look at the life of King Uzziah. From being helped by God with prosperity to seeing his fatal demise. This download includes a 1800+ word message in three formats, title slide, square graphic, and a slide graphic. Also included is the psd for the title slide. There is also a video suggestion that goes with the message. This message is great as a one-off between series or for special talks like at christian school chapels.

Name: #HUMBLE
Description:
In the book of Numbers, Moses is called the most humble man alive. Small problem though, scholars believe that Moses wrote that part of Numbers... So maybe there's something more to being humble than meets the eye.

We've all heard the phrase 'Meek as a Mouse' but what if there was something more to being meek too? What if the bible compares meekness to a war horse? In this two week series we break down what it truly means to be humble and meek, and how these two qualities could be a game changer in every believer's life.

Week One // #Humble
Week Two // Meekness

What this product includes: Title graphics, slide graphics, 2 instagram graphics, 2 weeks of Small group notes, and 2 weeks of message notes.

<a href='https://youthmin.local:8890/vendor/sampettersen'>Check out more products from Sam Pettersen here</a>

Name: How to Study the Bible 2 Week Teaching Series
Description:
Youth Pastors want their students to read their Bibles, but often we don't train them how. It wasn't until seminary that I learned how to study my Bible and grow in my knowledge of God. This series will equip your students with what they need to begin studying their Bibles.

DOWNLOAD INCLUDES
Two word-for-word manuscripts

Name: How to Ruin Your Life | 2 Week Series on Purpose
Description:
As Youth Workers, we know there are a ton of ways teens can ruin their lives ( or adults, for that matter). Trying to condense it all into 2 weeks would be impossible!

This series is a great concept that you can teach each year on different topics, and in this package, there are two weeks  on purpose and following Jesus in all we do. This is complete with both message transcripts in several formats, main title graphic and background, also links to all the YouTube videos used in each message.

We've also included a Facebook page header image to use (can also be used in parent newsletters) as well as 4 remade instagram images with scripture and bottom lines for each week, as well as two blank images to create your own social posts with.

Name: How to be Incredible sermon series
Host team badges
Description:
Grab this pack of badges, with multiple color variations, to print for your host team to wear!

These badges are designed to be worn on lanyards to help guests and parents easily identify who to turn to if they have questions or need any help.

Name: Hoping Against Hope - Avengers Infinity War One-off Lesson and Discussion Guide
Description: <p style="border: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; font-size: 17px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #797874; font-family: -apple-system, '.SFNSDisplay-Regular', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">In the latest Avengers Movie, the Marvel all-star superhero lineup finds themselves face to face with their biggest threat yet! A battle spanning the galaxy and a decade in the making leaves the Avengers, and the universe drastically changed. This one-off lesson takes a look at the concept of Hope and how hope can lead us through times of uncertainty, even when it seems as if all is lost.  This is a one off-youth group lesson that comes with everything you need to teach and facilitate a discussion with your group!</p>
Excerpt: Fully editable lesson and discussion guide manuscript.
Tags: Discussion | guide | hope | lessons | marvel | One-Off

Name: Hope - One-off Message
Description: Life's storms can lead us to doubt that Jesus is actually there for us. However, he is calling us to keep our eyes on him. When the storms are trying to carry us away we have Christ as the anchor of our soul. This download includes a 1800+ word message in three formats, title slide, square graphic, and a slide graphic. Also included is the psd for the title slide. There is also a video suggestion that goes with the message. This message is great as a one-off between series or for special talks like at christian school chapels.

Name: Holiday Postcards 4-pack
Description:
Grab this pack of 4 Holiday themed postcards to send to your students. Fully customizable, as well as blank versions you can print in the office, these are a great way to reach out to students during the coming busy weeks.

Send each student a handwritten card as you head into the season and at these major holiday celebrations, and your investment of time and stamps is going to pay off huge next semester!

Name: Hmm & Hmm vol II
Description:
How well do your students know the songs they spend hours listening to? In Hmm and Hmm, you’re going to find out!

Think of it as the musical version of Reverse Charades, with a student standing with their back to the screen, which pops up a new song title leading to a chorus of humming as the crowd attempts to get the contestant to guess what song they are all humming.

What makes this game even more difficult is that you’re students won’t be humming the same thing, whether they start on different tones or at different points of the song, leading to a hilariously bad sound cascading toward the contestant.

This download includes 12 game slides, a title slide, and 2 instruction slides in .png format for you to insert into pro-presenter or whatever presentation software you use, as well as a ready to go powerpoint, so you can download this game and play it today!

Name: Hmm and Hmm movie themes
Description:
How well can your students recognize the songs that shape the movies we watch?

Think of it as the musical version of Reverse Charades, with a student standing with their back to the screen, which pops up a new song title leading to a chorus of humming as the crowd attempts to get the contestant to guess what song they are all humming.

In this round, we went with popular movie themes, ranging from Moana to Jaws, but some of the most iconic songs of our lifetimes. Tags: everyone plays | games | lyrics | music | powerpoint game

Name: Hmm and Hmm Love Songs Edition
Description:
This is the perfect game for a series on relationships or during the Valentines Day season. Hmm and Hmm is a game played by having the audience hum a song while a contestant (or two) guess what melody is coming at them. We play it with guys against girls to add some extra fun, and our group loves it!

This download contains 14 .png image files of the 14 different slides for you to insert into your presentation software, as well as finished powerpoint that you can open and play the game instantly. The 12 songs we chose are a mixture between songs currently on the radio, and songs that would probably stump your average middle schooler who hates fun.

Name: Hmm and Hmm Christmas Songs
Description:
How well can your students recognize our favorite Christmas songs? How well can your audience recreate those songs with just humming?

Think of it as the musical version of Reverse Charades, with a student standing with their back to the screen, which pops up a new song title leading to a chorus of humming as the crowd attempts to get the contestant to guess what song they are all humming.

What makes this game even more difficult is that you’re students won’t be humming the same thing, whether they start on different tones or at different points of the song, leading to a hilariously bad sound cascading toward the contestant.

In this round, we went with popular Christmas songs, ones that everyone should know. It's perfect to play in December, especially at youth group Christmas parties. This download includes 11 game slides, a title slide, and an instruction slide in .png format for you to insert into pro-presenter or whatever presentation software you use, as well as a ready to go powerpoint, so you can download this game and play it today!
Tags: christmas | christmas party | everyone plays game | screen game | upfront game

Name: High States
Description:
If you love America, then you'll 100% love this game! High States is all about being quick on your feet and testing your knowledge of the U.S. A high stake game of fast-paced trivia about U.S. States.

States will slowly trace onto the screen, followed by slowly revealed facts about the state. The goal of the game is to name the state, but be quick! Your opponent can answer at any time.

Unlike many other games, this one is made using motion design, music, and sound effects, raising the overall engagement! It comes in PowerPoint format, as well as the 20 raw question and answer videos.

Name: High Five 5
Description:
High Five 5 is a great game for your small group or large group. The idea of the game is for students to find 5 people to give high fives to but they have to give high fives however the screen says. Use the game as a way for students to get to know other students.
Included:
-Powerpoint Game
-Editable PSD file
-Jpeg's of all images
-Game Instructions
-Picture of a cat giving a human a high-five...just because

&nbsp;

Name: Hey Jude
Description:
The Book of Jude is one chapter, but has a lot of meaning to how we need to be authentic followers of Christ by being alert of those who don't follow Jesus. This one-off message through the entire Book of Jude is to help build your students up to have the confidence in defending their faith and working together to grow closer to Jesus! This resource includes:
• 1 manuscript
• 1 set of small group questions
• Graphics
• PSD files

Name: Hello, My Name Is
Description:
The Name of God is a powerful tool in the arsenal of the believer. But what is God's name? Or, more accurately, what are His names? In this seven-week series, we go over the various names of God as found in Scripture, what they mean, and what they mean for us today.

Series includes
- Sermon text in Google Doc and Microsoft Word formats
- Title slides
- Original PSD files

Name: Heaven Came Down Christmas Design
Description:
This sermon graphic / poster is designed to enhance your Christmas message or series. Included in this package is the editable Photoshop file as well as a JPEG file. Merry Christmas.

<em>NOTE: You are downloading Photoshop files, and you will need Photoshop or an alternative program to open it and edit it.</em>

Name: Heart of Worship Youth Sermon Series
Description:
It's so easy for students to develop an understanding of Worship as being just what we do for 15 minutes during Youth Group. But as we know, simply singing songs is only a part of worshipping God, and it doesn't matter what songs we sing if we don't mean the words the rest of the week.

This short, 2 week series helps students begin to understand worship in a deeper way. The first week helps develop a biblical definition of Worship and week 2 helps students see what it means to worship God with all of our life.

Download this series now and work it into to your teaching calendar!

*This download contains two sermons in manuscript form along with 2 outlines for students to fill in during the sermon, all in word format.

Name: He Reaches Down
Description:
This is a one off message on how God reaches down to us in our mess and forgives us. The message comes from Luke 5 as Jesus begins to call His first disciples. This week should be encouraging for students who feel like they are never 'good enough' the main goal is to remind them that no one is and that is why Christ came. He comes to reach down and pick us up because we can't do it ourselves.

Includes:
-1 Sermon manuscript
-1 week of small group questions

Name: Hashtag Series
Description:
As social media becomes more and more involved in society today, chances are that your students are using it. Use this 6 week series to take a Biblical spin on some of the most common hashtags used today. In this purchase, you will receive:

- 6 weeks of curriculum and small group questions
- #SelfieSunday
- #ManCrushMonday
- #TransformationTuesday
-#WomanCrushWednesday
-#ThrowbackThursday
-#FollowFriday
- 6, week specific, promo Instagram images
- 6, week specific, promo Facebook cover photos
- 2 series promo images (Instagram and Facebook cover)

Name: Harvest Party Advertising
Description:
This advertising package is designed to help you create huge buzz for your fall Harvest Party. The poster is designed at 11x17 so you can print them and hang them. This advertising package includes an editable poster PSD as well as a JPEG of the final poster for your reference. You can resize the PSD file for postcards, projection graphics, or whatever else you might need. Happy Harvest Partying. Font used is Adobe Jensen Pro.

<em>*Note: You are downloading photoshop files, and you will need photoshop or a similar alternative in order to edit these files. You will also need a working knowledge of Photoshop to edit it.</em>

Name: Halloween would you rather countdown video
Description:
This video is a great element for the beginning of your service, as it functions as a 5 minute countdown and is a great mixer for any size group. With 5 would you rather questions themed around Halloween, it's a great tool to get your group talking, and ready for your service to begin.

As a bonus, this video comes in 2 formats, both 5 minutes long, but one includes music and one does not, so you can customize it with your own soundtrack.

[video width="1920" height="1080" mp4="https://youthmin.local:8890/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Halloween-would-you-rather-preview.mp4"][/video]
Tags: Countdown | Halloween | opener | service | video | video game | would you rather | youth ministry

Name: Halloween Reverse Charades crowd game
Description:
Reverse Charades is a hilarious up-front game for your group, and this
particular version is perfect for the halloween season or a halloween night at youth group. Simply
bring a couple students on stage to compete against one another. As the
words come up on the screen, the audience acts out the word on the screen.
The students on stage guess, and the first one to get the word correct wins
the round.

&nbsp;

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-268047" src="https://youthmin.local:8890/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/RC-Halloween-gif-300x169.gif" alt="halloween crowd charades game" width="300" height="169" />
Tags: crowd charades | fall | Halloween | October | reverse charades | screen games

Name: Halloween Pollsters
Halloween Game Bundle
Half Page event flyer (plus word format)
Description:
Got a big event coming up that you want help promoting? This half page flyer template is a great handout to pass out to students, stuff in church bulletins, or put up in local businesses to help invite students.

Flyer template includes a photoshop editable file, as well as word documents set up to match, so you can customize it even if all you have is word.
Tags: event | flyer | half page | promotional tool

Name: Haiku Movie
Description:
You ever get tired of hearing the same plots for movies, over and over again? This game reimagines the plot of some well beloved movies that will force contestants to really think through a movie. We've taken the plots of 11 different films and presented them in Haiku form for your students to decipher the correct movie.

For instance:

His best friend Andy

has a new favorite pal,

and that just don't fly.

If you guessed Toy Story, you're right!

This download includes 22 slide images (11 questions and 11 answers), as well as a pre made powerpoint with all the slides in order for you to just download and play instantly.

Name: Guest Welcome Card (DOC)
Guest central pack (On Sale!)
Tags: assimilation | guests | info card | parents | postcard | visitors | welcome letter

Name: Guess That Object
Description:
The guessing game that keeps them guessing! This youth ministry game offers students the opportunity to identify some object by giving them a cropped picture of the object. Simply show the cropped image and see if students can Guess That Object. Works great as an upfront game to kick off a fun night at youth group.

This is a PowerPoint file, and easily editable or capable of being added to. Enjoy!

Name: Group Rack Card (PSD/Doc)
Description: It can be hard to get a lot of information onto a visually appealing card. The Group Rack Card download tries to get all the critical information on a well designed rack card, so your small groups can get their information out!
Tags: graphic | groups card | small group | small group info

Name: Grinched Christmas Series/Event
Description:
GRINCHED: 3 Week Christmas Series

Who loves Christmas? Not a grinch! Have you ever noticed that we all have potential to be a grinch. Through this series you’ll help students wrestle down what could be at the root of their grinchiness and help them lose that grinch stench by taking some God honoring next steps. I wonder who will end up on your students “give” list this year? This was a student favorite series for us.

Week 1: The Heart
Week 2: Greed
Week 3: Kindness

This series includes:
- Title &amp; empty graphic slides
- Jpegs of pre-made talk slides if you don’t want to change anything at all in the talk. You can just throw them into your presenter software and be done.
- Talk-notes with graphics and fill-ins are in pdf or pages format only. Many of our students/parents have come to really appreciate these. I print them double sided, on cardstock, and use a corner rounder to round all 4 corners. It turns out looking pretty nice ;)
- Twitter/Facebook Banner
- Instagram Countdown Posts (i.e. 3days until...) to build anticipation
- Instagram re-cap posts: either a scripture or main idea from the previous week. It helps the message to stick throughout the week.
- Some weeks include videos/prop ideas and/or response moments
- Small group discussion questions or more cards really. We’ve found it helpful to put each question on a card #1-#8. Print them out. And pass them around the group. The cards more lead the discussion than the small group leader which we’ve found to be extremely helpful in building true discussion.
- BONUS Flapjacks &amp; Flannels Event: graphics &amp; game ideas that could be used any of the weeks to enhance the fun level of the series.

PS. I’m not an English teacher. If you’re looking for grammatical or spelling errors, you’ll find them occasionally.
Excerpt:
This series includes:
- ready to go slides
- transcripts, small groups, and handouts
- extensive social posts for the series
- BONUS Flapjacks &amp; Flannels Event

&nbsp;
Notes: I pray you have a great Christmas with your students. I hope this series helps to make things a little easier and brings some added challenge and joy to your youth group.

Name: Gospel Timeline
Description:
The objective of the Gospel Timeline series is to give students a comprehensive understanding of the events in the gospel. Week by week, as you guide your students through the gospel story, they will begin to understand this short summary:

 In the beginning, God CREATED all things and saw that it was good.
 Humanity SINNED, bringing about tragic spiritual, physical, and relational consequences
 The Father sent His Son, Jesus Christ, to RESCUE the broken.
 We live, HERE AND NOW, by loving Him and loving others.
 Our HOPE is in Jesus’ promise to return to make all things new.

Included:
A word document containing all five weeks (2-3 pages each)
A PDF document containing all five weeks (2-3 pages each)
Series graphics (PSD/JPEG)
Redemption Card handouts for week 3 (ready to print!)
Slides or handouts for week on The Fall

Name: Gospel Rumors
Description: A 5-week series of small group lessons that draw attention to the different false gospels both Christians and non-Christians can be lured into believing.

Name: Gospel of John Study Guides / Lessons
Description:
The Gospel of John is a powerful testimony to the person and divinity of Jesus Christ. Our hope is that these Bible Study Guides will enable you to lead students through this powerful Gospel in an interactive and meaningful way.

This package includes study guide sheets with opening discussion questions to get students talking, as well as interactive studies of each of the chapters of the book of John. This package includes:

-14 Weeks of editable study guides covering all 21 chapters of the book of John (Word &amp; Pages)
-Editable PSD of the Gospel of John background / template
-PDF Files of all 14 weeks (print-ready) for “quick” lessons on the go!

<em>Note: You are downloading PSD files - to edit these files, you will need to have Photoshop or an alternative program.</em>

Name: Gospel-Centered Worldview
Tags: one off message | stand alone sermon | worldview

Name: Gone Fishing - Life of Peter
Description:
This series is about the life of Peter as he walks with Jesus and follows Him to fish for people. We take 9 weeks to look the grace of Jesus in Peter's life and see how he transforms into the rock of the church Jesus called him to be in their first encounter. This series is intriguing to students as they get an overview of the life of Jesus through the eyes of Peter.

Week 1: Jesus tells us who we are.
Week 2: Jesus always pulls us up from our darkness.
Week 3: Peter gives his declaration of faith in Jesus.
Week 4: We need to trust in Jesus and take up our crosses.
Week 5: Slow down and see Jesus in what’s happening.
Week 6: We need to let Jesus humble us just as Peter was humbled by Jesus washing His feet.
Week 7: Jesus gives Peter grace for denying Him.
Week 8: When we let grace change us, Jesus will do amazing Kingdom work through us.
Week 9: Peter shows others how Jesus’ grace wins every time.

This series includes:
- 9 weeks of outlines for each message to give you an easy guide as you study for each week.
- 9 weeks of small group questions
- Social media graphics
- 9 weeks of social media recap graphics
- Presentation graphics

&nbsp;

But Wait! This resource is also part of YouthMin.org's Ultimate Youth Ministry bundle! While you're more than welcome to purchase this resource individually, you can grab it as part of our massive resource pack that saves over 94%! Grab this, and an additional 100+ resources!

Name: God's Masterpiece
Description: A message about God's greatest creation, His greatest masterpiece - you. This message focuses on Ephesians 2:1-10, with the most important message being in verse 10. File includes a simple message graphic, along with a text slide. Easily importable to PowerPoint or ProPresenter, and easy to use within social media platforms.

Name: Gods and Kings | Youth Ministry Sermon Series
God is...
Description: This 6-part series is all about the character and nature of God. We cannot fully follow God if we do not know Him, and know Him well. Each lesson looks at a different part of the nature of God, from God is Holy, God is Jealous, to God is Love and more.
Tags: Attributes | Character of God | God Is | Sermon Series | Truth

Name: #Goals - Leadership Lesson
Description:
Do you lead a team of volunteers? Do you have the desire to help challenge and grow them throughout the year?

This Leadership Lesson gives you everything you need to teach your leaders how to set goals and achieve them. Why do leaders set goals? Put very simply, leaders set goals because it helps define success. Now, there are a lot more reasons for leaders to diligently set short, long, and life goals, but we need goals to tell us where we are going.

This download contains a three page manuscript to walk your leaders (or even yourself) through setting excellent goals and a double-sided worksheet for your leaders to participate with. Equip your leaders to achieve more by teaching them how to set goals.

<a href="https://youthmin.local:8890/vendor/jholmes/">Click here to find more resources from Jonathan.</a>

Name: Go- A lesson on loving
Notes:
This is a teaser for a four week series called "Go Fight Win" (coming soon) complete with four weeks of teaching, three weeks of small groups, three screen games, graphics and 5 minute countdown. 

In the meantime keep fighting the good fight. 1 Corinthians 15:58

Name: Giving Thanks
Notes: Keep on keeping on! You're awesome! 1 Corinthians 15:58

Name: Girl Talk - What Not to Wear: Honoring Christ With Our Closets
Description:
We started a highly successful monthly girls event called Girl Talk, and I've included everything you need to begin it yourself! (well, except for cookies.) This event (hosted in our home) had many first-time guests each month and built a sense of community. I'm a youth pastor's wife and wanted to make it easier on other wives and female leaders to do a similar monthly outreach event. :)

What Not to Wear: Honoring Christ With Our Closets talks about the reason behind modesty- it's not just rules and regulations, but a deeply rooted desire to honor Christ in every area of our lives- even what we post on social media. Includes a few clothing tips to help make outfits more modest.

Included:
-Message with plenty of leader notes and some discussion prompts throughout
-Unique fashion competition idea for icebreaker
-Custom Instagram-optimized graphic for promotion
-Girl Talk branded graphics (poster and more) for ongoing promotion
-Ideas to build hype among students

Other Girl Talk topics are available, as well as a bundled set! Enjoy!

Name: Girl Talk - Dear Dad: Talking to God
Description:
We started a highly successful monthly girls event called Girl Talk, and I've included everything you need to begin it yourself! (well, except for cookies.) This event (hosted in our home) had many first-time guests each month and built a sense of community. I'm a youth pastor's wife and wanted to make it easier on other wives and female leaders to do a similar monthly outreach event. :)

Dear Dad: Talking to God explains the importance of a consistent quiet time, uses scripture to explain the power of prayer, and walks girls through the easily remembered ACTS method.

Included:
-Message with plenty of leader notes and some discussion prompts throughout
-Custom Instagram-optimized graphic for promotion
-Girl Talk branded graphics (poster and more) for ongoing promotion
-Ideas to build hype among students

Other Girl Talk topics are available, as well as a bundled set! Enjoy!

Name: Getting there
Description:
<span style="color: #3366ff;"><strong><em>This resource is also part of YouthMin.org's End of Year bundle! While you're more than welcome to purchase this resource individually, you can grab it as part of our massive resource pack that saves over 94%! Grab this, and an additional 100+ resources!</em></strong></span>

This is a great series to use as you kick off your school year or begin a new semester as it focuses on helping students take stock of the direction they are heading. Taking a look at the woman at the well, and how no one gets off course by making one choice, but by choosing the wrong things over and over again. In the same way, making good choices, over time, lead us to where we want to be and where God has us.

This sermon pack comes with series graphics, a bumper video, social graphics, and ready to go slides for each of the 3 weeks.

The big idea’s for these weeks:

Week 1 - Our decisions can take us further away from where we want to be without us even knowing.

Week 2 - The first step is to be real.

Week 3 - We can’t get thee by ourselves, we need community.

Name: Get Real Series
Description:
Many times, we can ignore some of the simplest teachings of the Bible because they're 'not that big of a deal.' But throughout Scripture, we see that these topics are often addressed. Looking at Ephesians 4, this series spends four weeks looking at issues such as anger, honesty, and our words. This will seek to challenge your students to Get Real in their relationship with Jesus.

This series comes complete with four weeks of full manuscripts that include built in discussion questions, illustration ideas, and suggested slides for presentations.

Week 1 - A New Mind
Week 2 - Anger
Week 3 - Honesty
Week 4 - Speech

Each manuscript is available in .pages and .doc format. Title slide and background slides are also included.
Excerpt:
Four fully editable manuscripts (.doc or pages)

Title and background slide for presentations

Suggested illustrations with links to videos

Description:

Name: Game Changer 4 Week Teaching Series
Description:
Have you ever heard the phrase, 'That's a game changer!' It is commonly used in sports commentating and a few recent commercials, but it's such a catchy phrase. A Game Changer is something that, when introduced, complete revolutionizes the industry. It changes the game for everyone! As Christians, what would be our game changers? That is what this series explores and talks about the importance of embracing these game changers in our own life.

<strong>GAME CHANGER</strong>
The Gospel
The Bible
Missional Living
Community (Small Groups)

<strong>DOWNLOAD INCLUDES</strong>
Four word-for-word transcripts
Slides (both ppt and jpeg)

Name: From Here to There Sermon Series with Small Group guide
Description:
The Woman at the well.

Matthew at his tax collector booth.

The disciples on the road to Emmaus.

Peter on his Fishing boat after the crucifixion.

Jesus encountered these, and many more, in moments of complete desperation, at their lowest, while lost. Yet in each of these stories, He redeems them, and sends them to greater things. When we read these four stories, we see them where Jesus finds them, and read about where he sends them.

But how do we get from point A, to point B. How do we get from lost to found?

Week 1 looks at where God finds us, and the importance of every one of our stories.

Week 2 looks at the decisions we make, are they taking us to where we actually want to be, or further away from where we hope to go.

Week 3 looks at the importance of community, of not walking from Here to There alone.

This download also contains a 21 day bible reading plan to coincide with the sermon's that you can print as is, or customize for your group. It also includes a blank instagram template with the series artwork for posting the daily scripture or sermon quotes as you go.

We've also included discussion questions to go along with the sermons, that are great for Small Groups.

Description:
Job is a book that is often preached from when discussing the storms in life. But that's not the only thing that we can learn from Job's experiences!

In this four-part series, each of Job's four friends teaches us something about how to deal with the good and not-so-good friends in our lives.
